results.description:
From Jeanne Murphy:

The Crystal Community Club's Halloween Monster Bash will be held on Saturday, October 31 from 7:30pm to 12:30am to benefit the Golden Giving's Gift Program.

Live entertainment by DJ  Tom B.

Full Cash Bar 21 and over

Buffett Dinner from 7:30pm to 9:00pm

Raffles

Best Costume Contest

Live Music from 9:00pm to 12:30am

Individual tickets $20.00 in advance or $25.00 at door

Table of 10 for $200.00

Questions call Kevin[masked] or the Crystal Community Club

Donations, raffle items and other help will be thankfully accepted.

Golden Giving's is a charitable gift giving program started four years ago for the elderly in area nursing homes. Golden Giving's has handed out over 6100 gifts to elderly citizens in nursing homes since 2008.
results.name: Halloween Monster Bash Charity Party Benefit for Golden Givings

results.description:
Boo! We squeezed another dance in October and it's going to be a ghoulishly fun time. The Zydeco Connection will set our bones a rattling and guide us into the night with our own Zydeco Monster Mash.


Costume optional. No partner needed.


Join us Saturday, Oct. 31 at 7:30pm for this special event.  Fee is $18.  First time dancers $9.


Free dance lesson will start at 6:45pm.
results.how_to_find_us: Full Scheduled at http://www.bostonzydeco.org
results.name: Special Halloween Dance: Zydeco Connection

results.description:
Halloween party @ 12 jenkins street in southie. Come in costume and party with us! We'll have snacks and some booze but feel free to bring you own. If you want to pick up some theres like 3 liquor stores nearby because southie. We have a decent kitchen and living room area and a large backyard for fun drinking activities!

Take andrew station on the red line if you are coming from the T. we are about a 5 min walk away.

If you're driving in theres good parking all along around old colony ave.

Hope to see you all there
results.name: Southie Halloween Party

results.description:
SAVE THE DATE

Recently, the Onyxbirds hosted its 1000th event.  To celebrate,  come show off your vocal skills at the Karaoke Costume Party.


EVENT DETAILS:


Cost:  $2 before 10PM ($10 thereafter)

Here's the Plan:

1.  Wear your most creative costume.  Yes! We will have a virtual costume contest (winner by popular vote)

2.  Pick your signature song.  Whether solo or in a group, Karaoke is more fun when everyone gets into the spirit. Background singers or dancers are always welcome.


3.  Be open and have fun.

PARKING:

$12  (SUV or bigger $30) Pilgrim Parking garage 40 Beach Street in Chinatown between Harrison Avenue and Washington Street

$16 (credit card only) LAZ garage 660 Washington Street in Chinatown between Beach Street and Essex Street

$20 (SUV or bigger $30) SP Plus Parking lot 47-55- Lagrange Street between Washington Street and Tremont Street

$25 VPNE Millennium Place garage 47 Boylston St  between Washington Street and Tremont Street)

$28 Tufts-New England Medical garage 274 Tremont St between  Oak Street and West Stuart Street
results.name: Obird Costume Karaoke Party

Costumes optional...Prizes for Best Costumes

Super Singles ® Dance where The Best Singles Dance Parties are Happening... All Meetup Groups and the General Public Welcome...RSVP Early...

Halloween Night - Saturday Evening - Oct. 31, 2015

(Meet Plenty of Super Singles who Love to Dance)

'We Are Giving Away $100. in Door Prizes'

SINGLES DANCE  8:00 pm -Midnight 

Dance Lesson @  7:15-8pm  (Not to miss)

Admission $15. Doors Open @ 7:00 pm

• Huge Dance Floor • Complimentary Pizza hors d'ouevres @ 8pm until they last • Cash Bar • Dance Mixer • Dance Lesson • Door Prizes • Win the Roses


Music by JAVA JIVE BAND

Don't miss It...Meet Super Singles from MA, NH & RI...Please arrive early for best tables.

The Lantana- 43 Scanlon Drive - Randolph, MA  Tel. (781)[masked] (Exit 5A-Rte 28 off Rte 128/93)

Bring your Friends...Other Meetups welcome...Open to the Public - Contact us with your RSVP List...

Business Casual Attire - Dress to Impress (no jeans, sneakers or hats) Sports Coats are suggested for Men

Click for Super Singles Photos http://www.supersinglesdance.com/gpage1.html

Get ready to get your freak on this Halloween. This year we’re taking over The North Star to provide you with the ultimate Halloween fest! Drink, dance, chill, romance and go absolutely wild. Gather your friends and loved ones for a truly spooktacular good time! 15 Meetup groups invited! 

Check out the photos from 2014

Check out the photos from 2013

******************************************

 Purchase your ticket here!

Time: Doors open at 9pm

Location: The North Star; 222 Friend Street

$35

TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT THE DOOR. THIS PARTY WILL SELL OUT.

Purchase your ticket here!

******************************************

Highlights include:

2 Complementary Drink Tickets 
Complementary apps 
Unlimited Candy 
Awesome DJ (twerk safely) 
Costume contest 
And of course, Glowsticks

COSTUMES ONLY! Dress code enforced!

******************************************

Costume Contest at 11:00pm! 

Most original 

Funniest 

Best Couple

Group Costume 

Sexiest 

***********************************************

*This party is for the young professional crowd: 21 – 42 only 

RSVP'ING DOES NOT SECURE YOUR SPOT. YOU MUST PURCHASE A TICKET.

TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT THE DOOR. THIS PARTY SELLS OUT EVERY YEAR. PURCHASE YOUR TICKET ASAP!

Meet to paint the model for a four week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $65, non-members for $75.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $65 or $75 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.name: Sunday painting

results.description:
Let's kick-off our South Shore Womens Events with a Sunday Morning Walk @ Pond Meadow Park (PMP) in Braintree!  This is open to all women in Social Fun and their female friends. This is one of our favorite walking locations on the South Shore.  We will be meeting and walking from the Braintree side of PMP.  One of the great things about walking at PMP is there are some shady areas along with some nice breezes once in awhile.  We should have some nice Fall Foliage to enjoy today as well!  Let's meetup and get to know each other while walking around the pond!

Pond Meadow Park consists of a paved loop as well as paved walkways to and from both sets of parking lots.  This path is hilly with some flat terrain.  If you choose to head out into the woods the trails are marked but not paved.  The loop is 1.6 miles, with the walk to and from the parking lot it is 1.9 miles. It takes about 35-40 minutes to walk the loop. If we walk the loop twice it's a total of 3.5 miles and takes between 1 hr and 1 hr and 15 minutes, depending on pace. If we walk to the street of the Weymouth entrance it adds .4 miles and takes about 5-10 minutes.

We will walk 1-2 loops today, possibly adding in the Weymouth entrance stretch.  1 loop plus that stretch will net us 2.5 miles in about 45-55 minutes.  2 loops will net us 3.5 miles in about 1 hr and 10-20 minutes, and 2 loops plus that stretch will net us 3.9 miles in about 1 hr and 15-30 minutes.  


A Few Items to Keep In Mind:

Your Yes RSVP means you will be attending and we are expecting you so please be courteous and change your RSVP prior to the RSVP deadline if you are no longer able to attend.

Pace: Today our walking speed will be approximately[masked]mph.  The first loop will be approximately[masked]mph for a leisurely pace for some and an average (or even fast) pace for others.  We will speed it up closer to[masked]mph on the 2nd loop for more of a fitness walk for most.  If a "slower" walker wants to co-host or lead a group on a "slower" pace for the 2nd loop then the[masked]mph speeds will be done together the first half of the first loop and then the fast walkers can speed up for the remaining 1&1/2 loops to[masked]mph and the slower walkers can maintain their pace.  *Please be respectful of our paces today.  I will keep us on pace and slow or speed us up periodically as needed.*

Attendees: Open to all female members and their guests age 21+ only.  No males or pets please.

This is weather-dependent.  

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  Sunday Morning South Shore Womens Walk @ Pond Meadow Park
Sunday, November 1st @ 9:30am ~ Don't Forget to Turn Your Clocks Back One Hour the Night Before!  (This will feel like 10:30am!)
Pond Meadow Park
470 Liberty Street, Braintree
[masked]      
Website:  www.pondmeadowpark.org
Meeting Location: Flagpole in front of Ranger Station


Event Host(s)/Organizer(s): Angela & Jodi Griffith

Min/Max: At least 6 Yes RSVPs 48 hours prior to the event.  There is no maximum for this event at this time.

Guests: 1 female adult per member is welcome.

Late Arrivals: We will wait our traditional 5-10 minutes for late arrivals.

Cost/Fees:  There are currently no costs or fees associated with this event.  PMP does have some donation bins if you so wish to do so.  If you want to make your annual voluntary contribution to Social Fun I will be happy to collect and mail it to Biagio.

RSVP Deadline: Please finalize your RSVP by 8:30 AM on Sunday, November 1st.  Any changes made after this time may not be seen by an Event Organizer prior to the event and are subject to our No-Show policy.  The Event Organizer(s)/Host(s) reserves the right to cancel this event if we have less than 6 Yes RSVPs at the RSVP Deadline.  While we have access to  email to see any last-minute changes, the RSVP Deadline is when we print the RSVP List and is the last time we may be on the website.

Inclement Weather: Heavy rains and/or temps below 45 will cancel. Please dress accordingly. (We will do our best to notify everyone if this event is cancelled by 10:00am on the day of the walk.)

Rain/Inclement Weather Date: None at this time as we will host more walks throughout the season.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions: Best directions should be taken from mapquest.com or maps.google.com. Located on Liberty Street, 500 feet from the intersection of Liberty and Middle Street near the Route 3 overpass directly across from Zana Park Drive.

Please note there is a rotary now instead of a regular intersection just before PMP.

From Route 3: Take Exit 17/Union St., Braintree. Exit on the side of the (Sunoco) Gas Station and Police Station. Follow Union Street to the first set of lights. Take a Right at the lights onto Middle Street. Follow about 1 mile to a Rotary. Go 3/4 of the way around the Rotary and exit onto Liberty Street. (This used to be a regular intersection where you took a left.) PMP is 500 feet up on the Right.
 


Parking: Free parking in 4 lots: lower lot immediately off Liberty Street, Upper lot inside gate which wraps around, and 2 lots further down closer to the trails which are past the first two parking lots (one is a grass lot on the right and the other is a paved lot on the left).  If it's before the park opens or is close to closing time then you can park on Zana Park Drive directly across from PMP.  Please be respectful of the neighbors; do not block driveways and park on ONE SIDE of the street.

Note: All of Angela's events are child-free and pet-free for adults 21+ only unless otherwise noted.  Thank you for being respectful of this request.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet by the flagpole in front of the Ranger Station.
results.name: Sunday Morning South Shore Womens Walk @ Pond Meadow Park!

From Jakob Sutor’s “New Illustrated Fechtbuch” of 1612

Cod.Guelf.83.4 Aug.8º

results.description:
Would you join me for this expo organized by Natural Awakenings Magazine?

This day-long film festival includes screenings of three enlightening documentaries, 60+ exhibitors, hands-on body and energy workers, and a diverse selection of workshops relating to mind-body medicine, personal growth and higher consciousness.

Opposite the film screenings, attendees will have the opportunity to experience Labyrinth Meditation independently or with a certified labyrinth facilitator walking through a 7-circuit Labyrinth. This space will also feature live harp musicperformed by award winning composer and sound therapist, Christine Tulis. 

Following the screening of The Power of the Heart, film co-creator and author of the book of the same title, Baptist de Pape will be conducting a Q&A with audience members and a book/DVD signing. 

To get your tickets: https://TROC.eventbrite.com 


Website: http://www.TheRevolutionOfConsciousness.com

-------------------------------------------------------


About the Films:

The feature documentary by Shannon Harvey, The Connection, which reveals groundbreaking research by the world’s leading experts in mind-body medicine and true stories of recovery. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oke17WPcCLM

People v. The State of Illusion, a film, by Austin Vickers, questions the very nature of reality, and through an examination of our perceptions, beliefs and imagination, makes you both judge and jury in what will be the most important trial you will ever witness. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CU-XoWezRww

The Power of the Heart, from the director of THE SECRET, Drew Heriot, comes this unparalleled and life-changing film about the astonishing power and intelligence of your heart. Following the screening of TPOTH, co-creator of the film and author of the book of the same name, Baptist de Pape will be present for a Q&A and book/DVD signing immediately following the film. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jobk3Usi73k

-------------------------------------------------------

About the Exhibitors:

60+ Exhibitors will be showcasing their healthy living healthy planet products and services. Vendors include; meditation, physical therapy, positive psychology, art therapy, yoga, tai-chi, Reiki, handmade jewelry, organic clothing and accessories, eco-boutique, journaling, nutrition, organic skin care, organic home products, integrative therapy, psychotherapy, chiropractic, Alphabiotics, Reiki, reflexology, massage, Egoscue Method, Alexander Technique, acupuncture, Buteyko Breathing, Tong Ren, fine quality crystals, Heart Mind Integration Healing (HMI), EFT - Tapping, energy healing, life coaches, essential oils, networking opportunities, green energy, sound healing, Active Isolated Stretching, alternative health benefits, Crossinology BIT, food samplings and more. 

-------------------------------------------------------

About the Workshops: 

20 workshops will be available, including: 

Art Therapy,Brain Coaching, Buteyko Breathing, Conscious  Community, Crossinology BIT, Emotional Freedom Technique - Tapping, Heart Mind Integration Healing (HMI), HeartMath®, Journaling, MindfulnessMindfulness, Morphogenic Field Technique, Network Spinal Analysis, Nutrition & Tong Ren, Perspective Reboot®, Psychotherapy, Self Awareness, Self-Discovery, Stress Relief, Tai Chi 

-------------------------------------------------------

About Natural Awakenings Magazine: 

We are a monthly lifestyle magazine focused on educating our engaged readers who value a healthy lifestyle and healthy planet for people and pets. In each issue, readers find cutting-edge information on natural health, nutrition, fitness, personal growth, green living, sustainability, creative expression and the products and services that support a healthy lifestyle. We feature articles by national authors as well as from local leaders in these fields. 

Tickets: https://TROC.eventbrite.com

Website: http://www.TheRevolutionOfConsciousness.com

----See you there!

Carpool is available from Reading.

 If you need a ride, please contact me before 6pm on October 31th, 2015

Thanks,

~Angela

results.description:
The Business

If you are looking to move into earning money from portrait and event photography then you need to start with the best advice. It is rare to find  a successful photographer who will willingly share their knowledge, skills and tips  - but in this six month tutorial series, professional photographer and experienced teacher, Ian Murray,  will walk you through the 'must dos' and  'you really shouldn'ts'  that have helped in his success.

It's a complete program that will teach you to avoid the many pitfalls and seize upon those actions that will drive your business into profit.  The central focus will be on operating and growing your business and improving your marketing, customer service and shooting skills.

Many photography businesses fail within the first two years and the failure has little or nothing to do with the owner's camera skills, they fail because of poor business skills. You can find many workshops that will help you extend your photography skills and workshops which will teach you business skills, in this series however you will be treated to the rare combination of having an experienced working photographer who happens to be one of the best teachers around, walk you through the 'must have' business skills you need if you are to succeed. There is no-one better placed to understand and teach the ins and outs of running a successful photography business than someone who lives and breathes it every day.

In six full one day workshops spread over six months you will cover :

• It's a business not a hobby!  -  thinking like a business.

• Understanding your business model

• Creating your business plan - and using it to grow your business.

• Finding and keeping clients.

• Calculating and managing costs.

• Setting the price.

• How to sell more.

• Marketing strategies that work - and plenty that don't.

• Networking as a way to grow your business

• Why customer service matters.

• Legal and tax issues.

• Setting up a space - do you really need a studio?

• Hiring assistants - makeup and hair-stylists.

• Delivering the goods - labs, frames and products

• Post processing strategies and efficient workflows.

• Storing and managing your images.

• Finding your niche.

• Expanding your repertoire.

• Keeping up to date - trends and how to get ahead of them.

• Equipment choices - the essentials

• Education - keeping informed.

• Finding inspiration.

• Getting publicity.

• Working smart.

• Building your portfolio.

• Portrait techniques

• Lighting theory and practice

• Posing techniques

• Managing a shoot

• Creative post-processing

• Weddings and events - how a pro does it.

• Wedding products - prints-books-albums.

• High school senior portraits

• Headshots

• Children and Family Portraits

• Corporate portraits

• Event Photography  

The workshop will run on one  Sunday each month  for six months beginning in January and ending in June 2015 and the series will be limited to just 8 participants.  The cost is just $600 for the complete program of six workshops.

Here are the dates of the workshops.

November 1

December 13

results.description:
You Are Invited to a One-Day Meditation Retreat: A Day of Motivation; Inspiration; and Spiritual Rejuvenation. 

Speaker: Ajili Hodari, Esq.

This is your day! In the never-ending whirlwind of life, take a moment for your soul. You will have the chance to come in contact with your inner self. You’ll be inspired to progress further on the path that can strengthen your connection with your true essence as soul and bring happiness, peace, and fulfillment to your life.  

Program Schedule:*

Introduction to Meditation: 20–30 minutes
First meditation sitting: 30 minutes
Break for feedback and
questions: 15–30 minutes

Second Session: Taming the Mind
Meditation sitting – 30 minutes
Break for feedback and
questions: 15–30 minutes

Join us for a light, complimentary vegetarian lunch.

Third Session: The Secret to Concentration
Recap and feedback related to prior meditation sittings: 15 minutes
Third meditation sitting: 30 minutes
Break for feedback and questions: 15–30 minutes

Last Session: Putting It All Together
Final meditation sitting: 30 minutes
Unlimited feedback and questions

Please RSVP and let us know if you are planning to stay for lunch. You may also register by clicking hereor pasting www.sos.org/event/newtonretreat in your browser.

*Feel free to attend any part of the program and depart during any of the breaks.

Ajili holds meditation seminars and workshops throughout the country, helping people learn the art of meditation. As someone who himself has been meditating daily for over 37 years, he knows the difference meditation can make in one’s life. An engaging speaker who relates one-to-one with his audience, he can help you navigate the challenges of stilling the body, stilling the mind, and concentrating within to see the light. 

A former Michigan State football player, it was no surprise when Ajili’s law career began in Columbus, Ohio with a focus on sports law, as an agent for NFL football players. In 2006 he opened his own law firm in Seattle, Washington, where his clientele is not quite so glamorous. Despite his busy schedule, he has flown cross-country to be here, and we are excited to have him in Boston. Ajili says, “I’m looking forward to sharing my experiences and helping others reach their meditation goals.”

Join us for a day-long film festival event from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., November 1, at the Westin Waltham Hotel. The films include the feature documentary by Shannon Harvey, The Connection, which reveals groundbreaking research by the world’s leading experts in mind-body medicine and true stories of recovery. The State of Illusion, a film by Austin Vickers, questions the very nature of reality, and through an examination of our perceptions, beliefs and imagination, makes viewers both judge and jury in what will be the most important trial ever witnessed. results.description:
These sessions at The Chinatown Community Center/Josia School will focus on a 6 week rotating schedule of classes designed to introduce the basics of Parkour in concentrate classes. The schedule will follow in order: 

• Safety, Landings and Balance

Class 1 will be focusing on how to land, move and stay safe practicing Parkour outdoor and in the real world. 

• Vaulting

Class 2 will focus on the foundation of Parkour - getting over low-level obstacles fast and efficiently through the use of vaulting.

• Precisions

Class 3 will focus on accuracy of jumping and foot/eye coordination honing basic standing and running jumps.

• Wall Techniques 

Class 4 will focus on conquering obstacles too large or tall to vault, in tandem with using walls as a means to keep a more efficient run.

• Tumbling/Acro

Class 5 focus is on tumbling and acrobatic skills, in pursuit of fully understanding movement in a 3D space and total proprioception.

• Flow + Speed

Class 6 links together all the previous lessons into one cohesive movement, and a timed obstacle course setting. ------

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before? 


This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. 

What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. 

What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. 

Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. 

We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)

We will be charging a $5 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. 

Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! 

I am available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out in a few weeks!! 

Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking

https://instagram.com/projectfreerun


http://www.projectfreerun.com/

results.description:
This is the regular meetup on Sundays at noon at Brooklyn Boulders in Somerville.  Meet by the first table/bench thing by the entrance.  Hopefully we'll get a good variety of climbing interests coming so that everyone can follow their climbing passion!

(Credit to Francesco Cardiello for the information below):
BKBS is the gorgeous, new, state-of-the-art climbing gym most convenient to those in the Boston, Cambridge, and Somerville area. Although pricier, it features 60+ feet toproping and lead climbing, a massive 22 x 140 foot bouldering wall (and there's still another upstairs), yoga & fitness classes, a sauna, awesome water fountains that fill your water bottle, a retail store, lounge area, weight room, and a soon to open cafe! There's even a collaborative work space where you can study, work, and climb!  If you are looking for a partner, or just want to get your climb on, join us for a fun time.

FAQ:

How do I get there? BKBS is conveniently located within a 10 minute walk of the Porter Square station. Walk down Somerville Avenue and turn right on Properzi way and head all the way down. It is also very bike accessible. If you drive, you can find the lot at 30 Dane St. It is located next to Artisans Asylum.

Why should I do this meetup? Since BKBS is such a new community (opened in late July 2013) few people have developed regular climbing partners to train and climb with. This is a great opportunity to meet other climbers interested in BKBS. Climbing is an inherently social sport - to toprope and do lead, you need to meet people who are dedicated to climbing. This meetup assures you'll meet a partner to climb with.

What if I haven't climbed before? First off, don't be intimidated. Everyone started somewhere. If you have never belayed before, please make sure to take the Learn the Ropes class. More info can be found here: http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before using the walls. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need? You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time? Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): Day Pass - $25 (Students $18)
10 Pack - $200 (Students $169)

RENTALS: Shoes - $5
Harness - $5
Chalk Bag - $2
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Sunday

results.description:
Come join us at our regular Scrabble Meetup, and play over lunch or a pastry and some coffee!

We meet twice a month, every month, on the first and third Sunday. Please bring a board if you have one. We have a few spares, so you are welcome to come even if you forget your board.

Newcomers are always welcome. We keep 2 and 3 letter "cheat sheets" for new folks to keep the playing field more even.

We mostly play Scrabble one-on-one, and pairing is random. If you would like to be matched up to someone of a similar skill, just let the organizer know.

Au Bon Pain is right next to the Davis Square T stop, and there is typically ample free street parking on Sundays.  A few times a year, there is a race in Davis Square that shuts down some streets, so keep an eye out for that. If possible I will send out a message to the group the day before.

$1/Meetup goes to help pay for the annual Meetup.com dues and miscellaneous photocopying, but if you are a regular $10/year will be easier for you and me to keep track of!

results.description:
Nectar is a talk-free dance inspired by conscious and ecstatic dance. It is a space to enjoy and explore embodiment, physical expression, and the body’s wisdom. After an unguided warm-up period, the Facilitator-DJ leads a brief opening circle on a theme or guided practice, followed by a playlist of music—beginning spacious and mellow, gaining intensity, and arriving back into stillness. Participants are welcome to move, dance, and be still as their bodies desire. Nectar closes with a sharing circle in which participants are welcome to speak about their experiences in the dance.

Nectar is offered primarily for adults. Children are welcome with adult accompaniment provided they can follow the talk-free and intentional structure and be mindful of their impact on others in the space. Kids under 6 can come for free, and ages 6-12 for half price ($5-7). $10-15 for adults.

Nectar was created by Amorn O’Connor and Harrison Blum, and is supported by a rotating crew of Facilitator-DJs.

Please note that many more people attend than RSVP via Meetup!

As an ethnically ambiguous, queer, transgender man Robbie knows what it feels like to be a unicorn. The good and the bad. He'll share best practices that can be used to create a welcoming community space.

Robbie Samuels has been recognized as a networking expert by Inc. and Lifehacker, and profiled in "Stand Out: How to Find Your Breakthrough Idea and Build a Following Around It" by Dorie Clark. Since 2009, his engaging and fun presentations have helped a wide array of audiences increase their confidence when it comes to relationship-building - whether through networking, fundraising, or sales.

results.description:
I have a confession. Earlier this year, I received this cookbook as a gift, and I've yet to cook one recipe from it . . . sorry Ina!

"Make it Ahead" is Ina's latest + greatest addition to her repertoire of cookbooks. She has yet to disappoint, so I'm confident that this book will be a great choice for our 2nd feast.


With the Holiday season just around the corner, Ina's smart recipes will make great additions to our family tables while enabling us to be more efficient with our meal preparation + planning! I don't know about you, but I'm always open to new ideas + advice on saving time in the kitchen (without compromising quality, of course).

So, who's in? Let's meet up + feast on several of Ina's recipes from "Make it Ahead" — order it online or find it at a local retailer. Note :: It's not required for you to buy a copy of the cookbook in order to participate in our events—email me + I'll hook you up; see if your library has a copy; or borrow one from a friend! 


• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

INSTRUCTIONS :: How the Cookbook Club Works

1. Join our Meetup group! All cooking levels are welcome. Don't be shy.

2. RSVP via Meetup. Note :: Each of our "feast" events will happen the 1st Sunday of every month, focusing on a different cookbook, and hosted at a new location in the North Shore. Everything will be organized by me, but you're more than welcome to offer suggestions of some of your favorite cookbooks.

3. Grab yourself a copy of the featured cookbook (ask your library, borrow from a friend, order online or purchase at a local retailer) and experiment with a few of the recipes.

4. Read through the cookbook + pick 1 recipe that you will make for the event.


5. In the comments section below, share which recipe you will be bringing. Note :: It might be wise to pick a backup recipe in case your 1st choice is already taken.

6. Day of the event. Prepare your recipe according to the directions provided in the cookbook. Source ingredients locally, if you can. As tempting as it might be to alter the recipe or make a substitution, please follow the instructions as closely as possible. This will allow the group to truly experience the author's array of recipes.


7. At the feast we will be eating family style with the food on a separate buffet table. Feel free to present your recipe on a nicer platter or bowl . . . it makes for a great photo opp.


8. Come to the event with an open mind + empty stomach! Together we will feast on your wonderful food + share our experiences with one another. Have your copy of the cookbook handy so you can highlight certain pages or make notes on recipes you especially loved. Note :: Feel free to bring your own food storage containers in case there are any leftovers available.


• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

WHAT'S INCLUDED :: (Stuff you won't have to worry about.)

1. Tables + Chairs

2. Linens, Tableware + Utensils

3. Extra Serving Utensils

4. Non-Alcoholic beverages + cups. Note :: If you want to bring a wine or beer to share, please feel free to do so!

5. Photographer (me or my friend, Paul)

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

results.description:
We have time for one more 'Get out & Shoot' outing before the cold weather moves in. This time, we'll capture the beauty of autumn at golden hour in Concord on Sunday, November 1st. 

Since November 1st is Day of the Dead/All Saints Day, we'll be meeting close to Concord's historic cemeteries, including Sleepy Hollow, where many of Concord's literary icons are buried.

http://www.concordnet.org/pages/ConcordMA_Cemetery/sleepy

However, our prompt will be open ended and you're free to wander wherever you like. 

We'll meet at 2:30 to introduce ourselves and catch up, then head out at 3pm for 90 minutes of Golden Hour shooting. At 4:30 we'll reconvene to talk about the shoot and share images.

Hope to see you there!

----------------------------------------------------------

*This location is not T-accessible.

*If we have heavy rain or snow on the day of the meetup, I will probably cancel. Please check your messages in the case of bad weather. 

*If you have questions or need to contact me, please message me through meetup instead of commenting on this page. Messages route directly to my inbox.

*'Get Out & Shoot' outings are occasional additional outings. We will also have a regular Improv outing, in a t-accessible location, during November.

results.description:
For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.

Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.

results.description:
Hey Hey!

It's very important to discuss important topics together as human beings so we can find solutions and get the ball rolling like a bowling alley.  Hit those pins of injustice.  You guys feeling me?  Well if you are check out the below information for this public forum!  See information below:

This event is free and open to the public.  Please make sure you register at the 2nd link below!  Don't just walk up in there like you own the place.

http://masshumanities.org/event/CC_2016_FORUM_01/


http://masshumanities.org/programs/symposium/


http://masshumanities.org/files/programs/symposium/MH-110115-poster.pdf



Our topic this year picks up on a recent op-ed essay by NY Times columnist Charles Blow in which he was addressing the ongoing conflict between NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio and the NYPB in the wake of the Eric Garner incident in Staten Island. Toward the end of his essay, Blow writes, “We have to decide what should racial conciliation look like in this country.” He then poses three crucial questions:

"Does [racial conciliation] look like avoidance and go-along-to-get-along obsequiousness, or does it look like justice and acknowledgment of both the personal parts we play and the noxious structural bias enveloping us? How is mutual understanding achieved without mutual respect being given and blame taken? How do we reconcile ourselves to one another without the failures of the systems that govern us being laid bare before us?"

These are some of the questions we plan to explore at our public forum this fall with an outstanding group of scholars, writers, and public intellectuals who have interesting, thoughtful and constructive things to say about how to understand and improve race relations in the United States.

Each panelist has been selected for his or her expertise on one or more key issues related to our theme. They include the classicist and political philosopher Danielle Allen, author of Talking to Strangers, Anxieties of Citizenship Since Brown v. Board of Education (among other works) and newly-named director of the Safra Center for Ethics at Harvard University; Yale Law School professor James Forman, Jr., a former Washington DC public defender currently writing a book about African American attitudes towards crime and punishment in the age of mass incarceration; Tommie Shelby, Professor of Philosophy and African American Studies at Harvard and author of We Who Are Dark: The Philosophical Foundations of Black Solidarity; and Beverly Daniel Tatum, former Mt. Holyoke College Professor, outgoing President of Spelman College, and author of books on the psychology of race (Why Are All the Black Kids Sitting Together in the Cafeteria?) and the re-segregation of schools since Brown v. Board (Can We Talk About Race?).

Our forum moderator this year will be Pulitzer Prize-winning historian and journalist Douglas Blackmon, author of Slavery By Another Name and Director of the Miller Center for Public Affairs at the University of Virginia.
results.name: Free Public Forum:  Citizenship, Justice, and Racial Conciliation

results.description:
Come join Cambridge residents and business owners in an open and casual environment to discuss your questions, concerns suggestions and vision for Cambridge and its government.

All are welcome and there is no agenda. This event is free and is taking place at Grafton Street Pub & Grill. There is a cash bar if you would like to order food or drink.

These Round Table events are organized by Kim Courtney and Xavier Dietrich, two Cambridge residents who are candidates for City Council. From their experience, there are not enough venues and opportunities to voice questions and concerns about the City and its operation, and they are interested in hearing from everyone who would like to share their perspective.

Please be on time since this meeting is only one hour.  This meeting is limited to 20 people so that everyone can contribute. Since space is limited, please only sign up if you can join us, and cancel if something comes up.
results.name: Round Table - Share Questions & Concerns about Cambridge City Government

WHERE: Tavern in the Square in Porter Square

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!

To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Look down the street. There's Tavern in the Square! If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Erika and Jack
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
For this month's book club, we'll be reading The Martian, by Andy Weir:

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0553418025?keywords=the%20martian&qid=1443889379&ref_=sr_1_1&s=books&sr=1-1


Six days ago, astronaut Mark Watney became one of the first people to walk on Mars. 

Now, he's sure he'll be the first person to die there.

After a dust storm nearly kills him and forces his crew to evacuate while thinking him dead, Mark finds himself stranded and completely alone with no way to even signal Earth that he’s alive—and even if he could get word out, his supplies would be gone long before a rescue could arrive. 

Chances are, though, he won't have time to starve to death. The damaged machinery, unforgiving environment, or plain-old "human error" are much more likely to kill him first. 

But Mark isn't ready to give up yet. Drawing on his ingenuity, his engineering skills—and a relentless, dogged refusal to quit—he steadfastly confronts one seemingly insurmountable obstacle after the next. Will his resourcefulness be enough to overcome the impossible odds against him?

I will supply light snacks and drinks, but please feel free to bring your favorite snacks and beverages to share.

I'll message attendees with my address a few days prior to the meetup.

Looking forward to catching up with everyone and meeting new neighbors!

Due to seating limitations, I unfortunately have to limit the group to 10 people.  If your plans change, it would be greatly appreciated if you update your RSVP in case anyone waitlists. Thanks!

results.description:
We will be coming together to explore our relationship with our living Mother Earth and with our own death……we will circle with our Ancestors….our Beloved Dead and all Beings………..as we honor this question:

How does my deep connection with Mother Earth inform, guide, inspire, and shape my lifelong journey with my own death?

Please bring: **Ancestor photo(s) for our Ancestor Altar
  **Backjack/blanket for optional floor sitting
  **Pledge or donation for Women's Lodge
  **Samhain attire as desired
  **Rattles/drums
  **Whatever will support your comfort

In solidarity with the enslaved/trafficked women whose painful, inspiring and hopeful stories we are reading this year in Half the Sky*, we will be sharing in a simple dish of rice and beans at the close of our circle, provided by Women's Lodge! (If you cannot eat rice and beans please bring your own alternative food in the same spirit.)

RSVP: Please RSVP by Sunday October 25th to Nouri Newman at [masked] .  Your timely RSVP helps us to plan for providing food and drinks in helpful, and not wasteful, amounts!
  Donations: Women's Lodge asks for a donation of $15 for our circle---accepting more, if you are able, and less, if necessary.  We also accept pledges of $90 for our full year of circles….from September through August!
  Location:We will be meeting at the UU Church of Medford, 147 High Street Medford 02155. 

If you have any questions please contact Lindsa Vallee at [masked].

*In reflecting on our divination for this year to come, we are reading Half the Sky as a community, so that we might learn a new walk with our own victim thinking, and stretch from individual orientation to group action on behalf of women around the world who need our advocacy. This inspiring book by Nicholas Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn, Half the Sky: Turning Oppression into Opportunity for Women Worldwide, so captures the spirit of this year's divination of transforming victimhood to empowerment that we are ordering enough copies for all of us to read--available at our circles for only $5 !
results.name: Women's Lodge Samhain Circle

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 35-45 --1W/3M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
RSVP only after you buy your ticket so I can keep track of how many have been bought!!!!



Kimberly

41 has paid ... If anyone else wants to go you have to click the link and buy your ticket - if they have any left ... If they do - then RSVP only after you paid

Hi everyone!!!

If you haven't heard.... Medieval Manor is closing their doors.  Just out in the Boston Globe.

Sooooo I made arrangements for us to go Sunday the 1st.  Once everyone gets wind of this, this place will be really hard to get into.  If you would like to join us, you need to buy your ticket in advance if there are any left. This will be a total blast!

Click this link to buy:

http://www.fokwb.com/index.php?app=ecom&ns=prodshow&ref=11015Mello 

"Fool around with Kimberly"  I have to say..that made me laugh!!

RSVP only after you buy your ticket so I can keep track of how many have been bought!!!!

ROCK ON!!

Kim

For $35 you get...

Fool around during dinner. A bawdy but light hearted romp through the dark ages has been on our menu for the past forty odd years.  There's no time like the present to join in the interactive fun (or just laugh along) with the King, Minstrel, Jester, Oaf and Wenches as they entertain one and all with slapstick and song. 

A six course feast eaten during the show without fork, knife or spoon adds to the fun. Pepper cheese trenchers, mussels, Faux Dragon soup, beef rib and salad precede the entree of roasted herbed chicken with steamed carrots. 

While you're feasting, refill your glasses from half gallon pitchers of dark or light beer or carafes of red or white wine (or Virgin Mead) by redeeming flagon tokens, one token per person.  Mixed drinks, bottled beer, soda or wine can also be purchased from the cash bar.
results.name: Medieval Manor/ Let's go before they close their doors forever.....

group.name: South Shore Hike, Bike & Social Club

results.description:
Hi Everyone

I've just realized that Suvaii doesn't open until 5:30 pm on Sunday, so I've changed the details. I'm in the process of communicating with them to see if they can do a buffet for us.

Suvaii has recently opened in North Cambridge. They were formerly Biryani Park in Malden, and operated a food truck in Boston last year. If you've never eaten Sri Lankan cuisine, you're in for a treat. Check out the enormous menu: http://www.snsmarketinc.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=83&Itemid=469. They've also got South Indian food, with 23 types of dosas! There are plenty of vegan options, but we're thinking that if we have a group of at least 6-8, they might be able to offer us a vegan buffet. That would be great, because it's really difficult to make a choice from the mouthwatering menu. Please RSVP as soon as you can, so that we can call them to ask about a special arrangement for us.
results.name: Eat Sri Lankan food!!

results.description:
The monthly Morningside Jazz Jam at Artlounge Arlington is a great way to meet people. Bring your instrument and sit in and meet a lot of other musicians, or just come and enjoy some live music. 

Artlounge offers craft beer, wine and delicious snacks. For more information on Morningside Music Studio, visit our website, www.morningsidemusicstudio.com

There is a $6 cover charge


For vocalists, you should instead go to the monthly Boston Jazz Singer Showcase/Open Mic and Ryles - more info at https://www.facebook.com/BostonJazzSingersShowcase?ref=hl

results.description:
http://www.brattlefilm.org/2015/11/01/special-preview-screening-brooklyn/
Brattle Film Foundation 15th Anniversary • Special Events

Special Preview Screening! BROOKLYN
Doors at 6:00 PM, Show at 7:00
DCP •
Special Brattle Film Foundation 15th Anniversary Event!
Co-Presented with the Boston Irish Film Festival!
(2015) dir John Crowley w/Saoirse Ronan, Domhnall Gleeson, Emory Cohen, Jim Broadbent, Julie Walters [111 min; DCP]
BROOKLYN tells the story of Eilis Lacey (Ronan), a young Irish immigrant navigating her way through 1950s Brooklyn. Lured by the promise of America, Eilis departs Ireland and the comfort of her mother’s home for the shores of New York City. The initial shackles of homesickness quickly diminish as a fresh romance sweeps Eilis into the intoxicating charm of love. But soon, her new vivacity is disrupted by her past, and Eilis must choose between two countries and the lives that exist within. With a screenplay by Nick Hornby (About a Boy, An Education, Wild) based on the novel by Colm Tóibín and an outstanding performance by Ronan that has already been deemed “Oscar-worthy,” BROOKLYN is sure to be a cinematic highlight of the season. Don’t miss your opportunity to see it first!

This screening is free and open to the public. No pass is required and seating will be distributed on a first-come-first-sat basis. Doors will open at 6:00pm. I saw the preview. Looks fun. We will meet at ticket booth at 6 to make sure we get tickets. Then we can grab dinner, drinks snacks at Cafe Algiers and go get seats around 6:45. I will be wearing a black Stetson.
results.name: FREE preview at Brattle

results.description:
Sheriden has again graciously offered to host this event at her home--discussion topics may vary depending on participant interest.

At Sheriden's suggestion, the discussion subjects could also include: self soothing, self observation, and connecting to others in meaningful ways.

Accessible via MBTA: buses # 90 and 89 (check mbta.com for schedule).

Parking is free Sundays and participants are asked to bring a food or drink item to share with 8 people.

results.description: We are an small group of dedicated men who seek personal fulfillment in our lives and families. We follow the general outline for running weekly meetings as originates from the Mankind Project. This outline motivates us to seek meaning in our lives at the same time providing emotional and spiritual support to each other. We hope that you will join us.  -Rich Emmel
results.how_to_find_us: We gather weekly on Sunday's (except 3rd Sunday) at 6:20pm in the far back entrance of the Winchester Unitarian Society Church, 478 Main St., Winchester.  Go to the back of the building via the driveway from Mystic Valley Parkway.

results.description:
From 6:30 to 7:30 PM, every Sunday evening, the BK Learning Center for Peace is open to everyone wanting to deepen their meditation experiences, filling the self with peace and power to develop spiritual capacity for the challenging week ahead.

Guidance and simple visual exercises that enable us to access our inner peace and strength will be offered during the meditation session.

 

All are welcome to attend and no RSVP is needed.

 

This is offered FREE OF CHARGE as a community service

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Our Speaker will be

Brad Meyer

Brad spent most of his working life as an audio writer, consultant, and music recording and editing engineer while President of Point One Audio of Lincoln, MA. Earlier, after graduating from Harvard in 1967, he joined the acoustics firm of Bolt, Beranek, and Newman (BBN) for several years before leaving to start his own business. He is a member and past President of the Boston Audio Society, edited its magazine, and spent some years on the Executive Committee (three as Chairman) of the Boston chapter of the Audio Engineering Society.

 Meyer’s early interest in music was further inspired by a family friend, Bill Wood, who started him playing the guitar and singing at open mikes on the early 60’s folk scene. He has attended the Summer Acoustic Music Week for about ten years and has performed, often with friends, at many of the local folk venues in the Boston area. He will discuss the broadening trends in folk music and illustrate them by performing some of his favorite songs. 

About the Dinner: Usually about 20 to 35 people composed of members and meetup invitees.

Social Hour: 6:00 p.m. Dinner: 7:00 p.m. Speaker : Around 8 p.m. You can come at any time.

RISTORANTE GRAN GUSTO

We have negotiated two reduced (!) price dinners. However if neither of these suit you you can order separately from their menu or not at all!

The two dinner choices are: A many(!) course Italian dinner at $36.00 or a pizza, appetizer, salad and desert dinner at $24.00. (The pizza is real authentic Italian pizza!) (tip included!) Or you can join the club and pay less per dinner!

Drinks can be ordered from the bar.
results.name: From Joan Baez to Brad Meyer! - Dinner plus folk musical interlude!

It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.

results.description:
This month we will discuss The Power of Now Eckhart Tolle. We will cover chapters 1 -5 this month and the remaining chapters next month.

A word of mouth phenomenon since its first publication, The Power of Now is one of those rare books with the power to create an experience in readers - one that can radically change their lives for the better. 

Eckhart Tolle is a contemporary spiritual teacher who is not aligned with any particular religion or tradition. He writes with the timeless and uncomplicated clarity of the ancient spiritual masters and imparts a simple yet profound message: There is a way out of suffering and into peace. He is the author of Stillness Speaks and Practicing the Power of Now. 

Join us on the journey


There is no charge for this event, however to use there room it is a requirement that EVERYONE that attends order food, I can't stress this enough, the restaurant is in business to make $$ and provide a service.  We are free to use their party room at no charge if we purchase food.  Please be respectful to this request. Order your food at the counter. Last time I was there, they announced when it was ready. 


No perfumes please we have members with allergies.

results.description:
Join New England Cohousing members for a Porter Square (Cambridge) house party/social tonight with free food and meet an organizer of The Canopy, kid-friendly community living in Boston, which is in its final fundraising push tonight.

https://youtu.be/T65EX7t4VEo

The Canopy is forming a nonprofit-owned housing cooperative in the greater Boston area for people who want to raise children in community. The organizers write "We believe that a different model for urban living with children can exist - one that is sustainable, practical, fun, centered on community, and built on creating networks of mutual support for adults and kids."

http://canopycoop.weebly.com/uploads/2/6/2/0/26207122/325072425.jpg?198

Meet house and campaign co-organizer Amanda, a New England Cohousing MeetUp member and CPA who currently works as a financial and operations analyst at a Somerville elder services nonprofit. She earned her MBA and Master’s in Accounting from Northeastern University. She is a theater and arts enthusiast, an alum of the Beacon Hill Friends House (a 21-person coop in Boston), and can usually be found zooming around town on her bike.


We'll provide free pizza, soft drinks, veggies/salad and some chicken wings; you can choose your own level of tax-deductible donation directly to Canopy, via its Indiegogo Campaign or in person via cash or check.

Note that this is about what we call "cohouseholding" - shared living under one roof, not cohousing as such. But given the costs of housing and the challenges for families here and elsewhere, we wanted to join in supporting this venture.

If you can't make it tonight, we recommend donating directly on the campaign page. Canopy is part of Boston Community Cooperatives, a 501c3 nonprofit umbrella organization that furthers the coop movement by creating shared infrastructure among several coop houses under joint ownership.


We're inviting folks from the Boston Co-op Network, so the headcount may exceed what you see listed here on the MeetUp group.

Note that if you are mainly wanting just to learn about cohousing, Tuesday night's orientation would be more useful for you. And keep an eye on our calendar for community formation meetings, open houses/tours, (un)common meals, and more.
results.how_to_find_us: 1 block from Porter Square T. Where the road curves and branches off to the tracks, look behind the fence.
results.name: NE Cohousing Social & House Party for kid-friendly community (Cambridge)
