results.description:
Dear hearts :) 

I'd like to let you know about our bonus of free Usui Reiki Level 1 mass attunement every 1st of each month. This free mass attunement is also actually given as our social service for those who cannot afford Reiki workshop fee but are willing to use Reiki channeling ability to help him/herself and others.

You do not need to register in advance to receive this mass attunement, just be ready during the schedule of 6.30pm local time. More details on this below.

Please understand that this free attunement is not Reiki Tummo attunement, it is Usui Reiki Level 1 attunement. In term of the attunement results, it is not the same as Reiki Tummo attunement because the Usui Reiki attunements will only open upper half of your main energy channel/sushumna (from crown chakra to heart chakra) while Reiki Tummo attunements will open the whole sushumna from crown chakra up to base chakra. However, this free Usui Reiki Level 1 attunement is given remotely by Mr. Irmansyah Effendi by means of Reiki Tummo attunement techniques, so the result is somehow better than traditional Usui Reiki attunement results. 

For more detail information about the difference between Usui Reiki and Reiki Tummo attunement results, please use your yahoo email address to sign in to this group web page (http://groups.yahoo.com/mygroups) and then visit the file section of this group or click:
http://health.groups.yahoo.com/group/Kundalini_Reiki/files/DRAWINGS_PHOTOS_ILLUSTRATIONS/ and the file name is: AttunementComparisonUsuiReikiTummo.gif
You are welcome to explore and study other drawings there and put questions on this list.

For more detail information about Reiki Tummo You can also buy Reiki Tummo book ("REIKI TUMMO: An Effective Technique For Health and Happiness" is written by the founder and Grandmaster of Reiki Tummo, Irmansyah Effendi, MSc.) at www.amazon.com (ISBN:[masked])

Since it is given by means of Reiki Tummo attunement technique, the result is very good for cleansing your crown chakra, heart chakra as well as palm chakras and energy channels. All alumni of Reiki Tummo workshops from Padmacahaya or Padmajaya are entitled to join and receive this free mass attunement as Reiki Tummo attunement (because you already received one before). 

Please read the instruction below on DISTANT ATTUNEMENT PREPARATION. Also since the main benefit of the attunement is to help your heart get better connection to Divine Love and Light so your heart can be opened and cleansed better by Divine Love and Light then we suggest you to also do OPEN HEART PRAYER/MEDITATION daily before and after the attunement. Please read more information below. 

May you enjoy and get benefit from this mass attunement. 

Much Love and Light for your beautiful hearts, :) 

----------------------------------------------------------
DISTANT ATTUNEMENT PREPARATION
Note: No need to register in advance, just be ready during the attunement.

WHAT TO DO FOR A DISTANT ATTUNEMENT

1. You do not need to register to receive this free mass attunement of Usui Reiki Level 1. Just prepare your self at the day of the attunement (1st of each month) 
2. No need to adjust your local time any longer. The attunement has been programmed to be received every 1st of each month at 6.30 PM YOUR OWN LOCAL TIME, where ever you are, for 15 minutes duration. 
3. Please study how to do Self Healing/Treatment with Reiki. You can find this in some web pages or in some Reiki books. You do need to do self healing right away after the attunement is finished to make good use of the attunement energy flow that is still working on you even though the attunement is over already. Please see Note below for suggested hand positions during self healing. 
4. On the attunement day, try to get a room where you will not be disturbed. The attunement will take about 15 minutes. It is best to have a room in which the light is not too bright. If possible, have new age music and incense or aroma therapy ready. Dim light and music will help you to get relaxed easily. The incense or aroma therapy will be needed to neutralize the negative energy that will come out of you during the attunement. Remember the attunement is also a cleansing process. 
5. About 30 minutes before the attunement, it is good to start doing simple and light exercises that move most parts of your body, but don't make yourself exhausted. Simply do exercise for about 30-60 seconds for each part of the body. This will help energy flow even better in your physical body layer. 
6. Since the attunement will help opening your heart connection to Divine energy, then for better result, we suggest you to do Open Heart Prayer/Meditation after doing simple exercises. That can be done about 15 minutes before the attunement. Please read more information on Open Heart Prayer/Meditation below. 
7. After the simple exercises and Open Heart Prayer, get relaxed, dim the light, and turn the music on. Light incense before the attunement starts. Sit on a chair; try to keep your spine straight without forcing it. Make sure that your legs are not crossed and it is better if both feet are grounded. Put both of your hands on your thighs with your palms facing upwards. Please don't fall asleep during the attunement! :) 
8. During the attunement, simply relax. Do not make any effort to concentrate. Do not practice any breathing technique. Try to be as still as possible and enjoy whatever happens. It is a good practice to always relaxed, smile at your heart and surrender to Divine Source of Love and Light during the attunement. Also be willing to open your heart to Divine Source to receive more Divine Love and Light during the attunement. It is all done by intention only and then relaxed, smile and enjoy the attunement process. DO NOT EXPECT anything to happen since this will make you are not relaxed anymore :) 
9. After the attunement, do a complete self-healing directly. Take your time and do it properly and enjoy with smile and happy feeling from your heart all the time. 
10. After self-healing, try to do the same simple exercises you did before the attunement to help your physical body absorb Reiki energy better.
11. Keep on doing self healing for at least 21 days. It is best to do it every day even after you pass the 21-days period to maintain your health and improve your energy. Also, since the main benefit of channeling Reiki energy is to open and cleanse our heart, then it is always better to do Open Heart Prayer also every day to cleanse and keep our heart open better for Divine Love and Light.

Note: 
1) Suggested hand positions for channeling Reiki energy during Self Healing are (3 minutes per position sequentially): 
FRONT OF THE BODY: Forehead/face, Cheeks, Throat, Upper chest, Lower chest, Stomach, Thighs, Knees, and Ankles
BACK OF THE BODY: Back of the head, Nape of the neck, Upper back, Lower back/waist, Buttocks, Back of thighs, Calves and Soles of the feet 
2) More detail and complete techniques about doing healing and other Reiki techniques will be taught in Reiki Tummo workshops. Visit www.padmacahaya.com or www.padmacahaya.org for more information.
3) Please feel free to share your experiences after the attunement and doing Self Healing for 21 days and Open Heart Meditation every day.

----------------------------------------------------------
OPEN HEART PRAYER/MEDITATION
(By Irmansyah Effendi)

Each time we have negative emotion, we leave / deposit negativities within our heart. How many time a day we have negative emotions, even though we do not show them. To cleanse the heart further (bigger and deeper), the best way is to ask for blessing from the True Source of Love and Light. 

Before you start this prayer, you may need to write down the name of the people you don't like (you need to forgive), and for what you need to ask for forgiveness. You can replace the terminology “True Source” with any other terminology which you are more comfortable with / can relate better to.

STEPS:
(Follow your feeling while praying)
1. Touch your heart (center of your chest) with 1 or 2 fingers
2. Close your eyes
3. Relax
4. Smile
5. Smile to your heart sweetly and freely
6. Feel the nice feeling from your heart, smile and stay within that nice feeling along the prayer
7. Pray (from the heart with feeling and love): 
1) True Source, please bless our heart so that all arrogance be removed, to be replaced with Your Love and Light.
2) True Source, please bless our heart so that all selfishness be removed, to be replaced with Your Love and Light.
3) True Source, please bless our heart so that all anger be removed, to be replaced with Your Love and Light.
4) True Source, please bless our heart so that all envy and jealousy be removed, to be replaced with Your Love and Light.
5) True Source, please bless our heart so that all greediness and cunningness be removed, to be replaced with Your Love and Light.
6) True Source, please bless our heart to understand that peace, calmness and joy are better than negative emotions. We have to let go of all negative emotions toward others, so that You can bless our heart, to fill our heart with Your Love and Light, peace, calmness and joy. Please bless and help us to be able to forgive everyone sincerely.
{Now, forgive everyone sincerely, although the same person has been doing the same negative things repeatedly and is still doing it. Remember that keeping negative emotion in you will simply give you pressure and burdens.}
7) True Source, as we have forgiven everyone else, please bless our heart so that all hatred, sadness, resentment, disappointment and other negative emotions, be removed to be replaced with Your Love and Light.
8) True Source, please bless and help us to realize that You are All Loving and All Forgiving. Please bless and help us to realize all of our mistakes, be remorseful, and ask for forgiveness. 
{Now, realize all of your mistakes, be remorseful, and ask for forgiveness.}
9) True Source, as You have forgiven all of our mistakes, please bless our heart and whole being so that all fear, worry, and burdens because of those mistakes, be removed to be replaced with Your Love and Light.
10) True Source, please bless and help us to be able to stay within our heart, within Your Love and Light, to always be peaceful, calm, and joyful.
11) True Source, thank You for all of Your blessing, Love and Light.
12) Amen.

Note:
a. Since the most important benefit of Reiki attunement for our heart is to open and connecting our heart better to Divine Love and Light to cleanse our heart further, so for better results of Reiki attunement on your self and heart, it is suggested to do this Open Heart Prayer prior to receiving the attunement (say starting 2 weeks daily before the attunement) and every day after the attunement. 
b. The Open Heart Prayer CD in English or Indonesian language is available for purchase. 
c. More techniques and practice on opening and activating your heart can be learnt through Open Heart Workshop from Padmacahaya. For more information on Open Heart Workshop please visit http://openheartworkshops.com

results.description:
Science and Cooking - A semester-long public lecture series that pairs Harvard University professors with popular chefs and food experts to showcase the science behind different cooking techniques. This lecture series is sponsored by the Harvard University John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences. 

Full schedule below and HERE. Free and open to the public. 

:: :: ::

Lecture 8) Monday, Nov. 2 - Title TBA - Bryan Voltaggio, (@BryanVoltaggio), Volt - Michael Voltaggio, (@MVoltaggio), Ink


:: :: ::


These public lectures are based on the Harvard course “Science and Cooking: From Haute Cuisine to the Science of Soft Matter,” but do not replicate course content. Unless otherwise noted, all talks take place in the Harvard Science Center (1 Oxford St., Cambridge, Hall C) and begin at 7 p.m. Each presentation begins with a 15-minute lecture by a faculty member from the Harvard course, who will discuss one of the scientific topics from that week’s class. Seating for all lectures is first come, first seated. If you have questions regarding this public lecture series, please contact [masked]. 

:: :: ::

Sample Lecture: Explorations of Chocolate Textures [Lecture 4 (2012)]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tt9g2se1LcM&index=10&list=PL546CD09EA2399DAB


 Full schedule

Lecture 1) Monday, Sept. 7 - Thinking about Flavor - Dave Arnold (@CookingIssues), Booker & Dax, and host of “Cooking Issues” and Harold McGee (@Harold_McGee), writer, “Curious Cook”


Lecture 2) Monday, Sept. 14 - Pasta Magic - Mark Ladner, (@ChefMarkLadner), Del Posto

Lecture 3) Monday, Sept. 21 - The Science of Sugar - Joanne Chang ’91, (@jbchang), Flour Bakery, author of “Flour” and “Flour Too”

Lecture 4) Monday, Sept. 28 - Title TBA* - *Jim Lahey, (@jimlaheySSB), Sullivan Street Bakery

Lecture 5) Monday, Oct. 12 - Science and Emotions: Delicious or Disgusting? - Andoni Aduriz, (@mugaritz), Mugaritz and Ramon Perisé, Mugaritz

Lecture 6) Monday, Oct. 19 - Heat Transfer to Capture Flavors - Josep Roca, (@CanRocaCeller), El Celler de Can Roca and Raül Sillero, El Celler de Can Roca

Lecture 7) <Location TBA> Tuesday, Oct. 27 - Viscosity and Polymers - José Andrés, (@chefjoseandres), ThinkFoodGroup

Lecture 8) Monday, Nov. 2 - Title TBA - Bryan Voltaggio, (@BryanVoltaggio), Volt*Michael Voltaggio, (@MVoltaggio), Ink

Lecture 9) Monday, Nov. 16 - Fermentation on Wheels: Food Education and Community Impact - Tara Whitsitt, (@tarawhitsitt), Fermentation on Wheels

Lecture 10) Monday, Nov. 23 - Title TBA - Nathan Myhrvold, (@ModernCuisine), former Chief Technology Officer of Microsoft, co-founder of Intellectual Ventures, author of “Modernist Cuisine”

Lecture 11) Monday, Dec. 7 - Title TBA - Tom Colicchio, (@tomcolicchio), “Top Chef” judge and chef/owner, Craft Hospitality, and Mei Lin, (@meilin21), “Top Chef” season 12 winner, and Gail Simmons, (@gailsimmons), “Top Chef” judge, Culinary expert, and Food & Wine magazine Special Projects Director

:: :: ::

The Harvard College Course: The Harvard John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS) and the Alícia Foundation developed a General Education science course, “Science and Cooking: From Haute Cuisine to the Science of Soft Matter,” which debuted in the fall of 2010. The course uses food and cooking to explicate fundamental principles in applied physics and engineering. (Watch a video about the course.) Limited to currently enrolled Harvard undergraduates, the class brings together eminent Harvard researchers and world-class chefs. 

:: :: ::

A version of “Science and Cooking” is offered for credit through the Harvard Extension School. An online course will be offered in the fall and spring semesters. Registered students will have access to the expertise and support of Harvard teaching staff.

:: :: ::

For more info visit <a>www.seas.harvard.edu.</a>

results.description:
**Please note the Harvard Film Archive is cash-only. Admission to this event is $9.**

People have been telling me for years to see this Czech coming-of-age film set against surreal, fantastic backdrops. From the HFA:

Valerie’s screenwriter and production designer, Ester Krumbachová, secret auteur of the Czechoslovak New Wave, must be given equal credit with director Jaromil Jires for this lush, decadent fairytale. A colorful (mostly purple) extravaganza set in the 18th century (or is it the 19th?) amid festivities in a small village filled with witches and vampires, this was the national film movement’s last gasp after the Soviet crackdown in 1968.
The tale of a 13-year-old girl’s sexual awakening against a Freudianized Alice in Wonderland, Wizard of Oz or Brothers Grimm backdrop, except more evil—more like one of Angela Carter’s feminist reworkings—Valerie sets up a series of magical battles for its tween protagonist’s future happiness, which is linked to her erotic longing. Valerie is excessively creepy and painfully beautiful, a unique work stocked with pearls, wine and green apples, its scenes often glimpsed through keyholes. Easy to see how it confused bureaucrats, the film escaped censure. It could not be made in any country today.
results.name: Valerie and Her Week of Wonders, Harvard Film Archive

Beat Brasserie (aka Beat Hôtel) is an American restaurant and bar located in the heart of Harvard Square. Opened by the team behind The Beehive, the wildly popular eatery and bar in Boston's South End, Beat Brasserie offers a fresh, seasonal menu, enjoyable by carnivores and vegetarians alike. Our bar celebrates American spirits, beer and features over 35 American artisanal wines by the glass or carafe on our state-of-the-art wine tap system. Many of our wines have been crafted exclusively for Beat by the nations premier small batch winemakers. To heighten the senses further, we feature live music by cutting edge musicians in jazz, blues, funk, R&B and world music, bringing eclectic artistry to our stage in Cambridge.

results.description:
Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University presents:
FLORAL REWARDS AND BEE-HAVIOR

Daniel Papaj, PhD, Professor and Associate Head, Ecology and Evolutionary Biology, University of Arizona

1 Session: Monday, November 2, 7:00–8:15pm
Location: Hunnewell Building

How does learning shape behavior in bees? What roles do flowers play in influencing bee activity? Researcher Daniel Papaj will speak about floral rewards and discuss nectar guides, buzz pollination, and bee decision-making in that context. He will also share some great video of bees in action.

Fee Free, but registration (link below) requested.
http://my.arboretum.harvard.edu/

This event pertains to the general beekeeping community, and is not an official BABA event.

results.description:
Join us on Monday 11/2 at PJ Ryan's for some rare and tasty brews from Brooklyn! Drinking rare winter beers has been clinically proven to help battle daylight savings time... so RSVP and come have a beer!

•  Try the extremely rare draught only reserve release, Lord Sorachi. This amped-up version of the Sorachi Ace comes in at 9.5% and is described as sunshine in a glass - just what the doctor ordered for the dark days ahead.

• With the chill of fall and winter comes great porters - the Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout is no exception - boasting a deep chocolate flavor, it's a must have. If you haven't had it yet, you need to try it. In fact, you need to get it even if you HAVE had it! 

• Patrick from Brooklyn Brewery will be around to talk shop and answer any burning questions you might have. If you're lucky, you might even get some SWAG! 

There will be tons more Brooklyn beer, including a brand new Dark Lager, tall boy Brooklyn Ale cans, and of course, a free raffle! So come prepare yourself for the week ahead with some really great beer. RSVP and I'll see you there!

Alex has graciously accepted giving us an introduction to one of his favorite 28mm skirmish wargames: Infinity. This is a sci-fi game played with around 10-15 figures on a 4'x4' terrain heavy table. It is rapidly gaining popularity and is worth looking at. No need to bring figures. The game has very interesting mechanics.  It is also not as as expensive as other wargames, if you decide to start collecting the figures.  You can <a>browse rules on the Infinity site</a>, but Alex will explain it all.

We have 4 armies, so we will be able to have at least 4 players actively playing at a time, others welcome to watch or play on the 2nd round.  If you do play Infinity already, please bring your army(ies) and/or terrain.

Some information about the game on popular websites on the internet.  1d4chan, wikipedia, and Beasts of War.

Game room will be open if you want to play another game (on top of the regularly scheduled board games session next day). If you plan to play something other than Infinity, leave a comment on this event looking for players of the game you are interested in playing).   The usual pizza available and the usual cup for the $5-$10 contribution for the pizza / snacks / beverages.  Feel free to bring other snacks or beverages.

More details to follow.


The figures look amazing, even unpainted:

People go overboard with terrain:

****From Boston Phil. : 


Mon, 11/02/2015 - 7:30pm FREE CONCERT

Symphony Hall

This concert is presented as a FREE public event, made possible by the <a>Free for All Concert Fund</a>!

The stunning program that opens the season for the Boston Philharmonic Youth Orchestra has been expressly designed to show you, in case you don’t already know, just what the Boston Philharmonic Youth Orchestra is all about. A brilliant, showy, roof-raising overture, followed by three masterpieces, all in completely different styles and making staggering demands on the players.  At the center of the program is Debussy’s beloved La mer.Debussy’s score is the iconic French orchestral masterpiece of the twentieth century, ever-fresh, beloved, endlessly imitated by other composers. It is the ultimate orchestra seascape – quintessentially French and as salty as they come. 

The Debussy is surrounded by Russian masterworks, both familiar and unfamiliar. Stravinsky’s Violin Concerto is a work that overflows both with tenderness and wit. It is astoundingly virtuosic for the performer, who must negotiate instrumental acrobatics that are far outside the normal arsenal of a virtuoso’s technique. We are extremely fortunate to have as our soloist the brilliant Ayano Ninomiya, who is first violin of the world-famous Ying Quartet. The familiar and exhilarating Overture to Ruslan and Ludmila opens the program, and to conclude, the Tchaikovsky Fifth Symphony, a great favorite with audiences and known to just about everybody. But Mr. Zander’s take on the piece is bracing and fresh.  He has performed it many times, in many parts of the world, and always audiences are stirred by the experience of having the familiar made new again.

No need to purchase any tickets for this event, it is completely free and we are seating on a first come first serve basis! 

*If you have any questions please call the box office at[masked] or email 

[masked]

results.name: Boston Phil. Youth Orchestra @ Symphony Hall FREE!

results.description:
A sense of true emotional connection with trusted loved ones, be they family of origin or chosen family, can open us to ourselves in ways nothing else can.

The feeling of coming home that comes with our allowing ourselves to be present and connected to others creates a sense of security that can help us come into our own power as individuals.  Identifying our kinship with many different "tribes" allows us to experience the many aspects of ourselves that make up the unique totality of who we are.


In addition to our connections with our own family members, which members of our chosen family over the course of our lifetime have taught us the most about ourselves by being in a loving and trusting relationship with us?  How have even the difficult emotions that can accompany love brought us to a place of greater wisdom?

How do we experience a positive sense of family, especially if aspects of our family of origin have not helped us feel safe?  How do we create and experience home as a place where we can safely be ourselves?

There is always a 10-minute guided meditation at the end of the discussion.

Also, over the last several months, it has become a tradition for those of us so inclined to continue our conversation up the street at JP Licks immediately following the monthly discussion.

Please remember to avoid using scented personal products before coming to the meetup as some of our members are chemically sensitive.

A contribution of $5 (or whatever you can afford) toward the meeting room rental and organizer fee is greatly appreciated.  And please change your RSVP before 7 p.m. if you are unable to attend.

There is free parking after 6 p.m. in the lot across the street from the church. To find us, enter the last door on the right at the end of the driveway at the side of the church.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the last door on the right at the end of the driveway at the side of the church.  We meet in the second room on the left.

results.description:
Next script up is penned by David Lynch (aka known as NOT THAT David Lynch). 

David is not only an amazing time-traveller (see below on the left)...


he is also known for his famous experiments in DNA recombinant homo sapien canine therapy, a technique developed for everyone in need of a service dog who wants to eliminate hassles in restaurants, grocery stores, buses, trains, and on airlines.  


Don't worry, he only bites script reviewers.

Anyway, his log line is as follows:

A soldier guarding the secrets of an ancient tomb comes to rely on the aid of a professional thief when she is betrayed by her superiors and forced to pit herself against giant centipedes, lethal magic, and a power mad war criminal. 

Dave explains, "This fantasy adventure features a strong female protagonist opening it up to 18 to 35 year olds of both genders. It can be thought of as 48 Hours meets Raiders of the Lost Ark in a setting similar to Lord of the Rings or Game of Thrones."

A big welcome (overdue) to many of our newest members including Sue, Rebecca, Noi, Kwasi and our latest intern Jackie.  Meeting is in our fab new location at 66 Winthrop St.

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are Ladies' Night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Please RSVP if possible; helps everyone to know others are coming.  Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from the cubbies, if available) from 7 - 7:10 PM.  (NOTE: In the rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive within this time window, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).  If arriving later, just come find us on the walls.  Hopefully you can recognize us, the Event Host(s) (see RSVP list), from our profile pictures, and/or check the small Whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what we're wearing that day.

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing. For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Level 1 Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from cubbies, if available).

results.description:
A little spooky for the holiday! "Few creatures of horror have seized readers' imaginations and held them for so long as the anguished monster of Mary Shelley's "Frankenstein." The story of Victor Frankenstein's terrible creation and the havoc it caused has enthralled generations of readers and inspired countless writers of horror and suspense. Considering the novel's enduring success, it is remarkable that it began merely as a whim of Lord Byron's.
"We will each write a story," Byron announced to his next-door neighbors, Mary Wollstonecraft Godwin and her lover Percy Bysshe Shelley. The friends were summering on the shores of Lake Geneva in Switzerland in 1816, Shelley still unknown as a poet and Byron writing the third canto of "Childe Harold." When continued rains kept them confined indoors, all agreed to Byron's proposal.
The illustrious poets failed to complete their ghost stories, but Mary Shelley rose supremely to the challenge. With "Frankenstein, " she succeeded admirably in the task she set for herself: to create a story that, in her own words, "would speak to the mysterious fears of our nature and awaken thrilling horror one to make the reader dread to look round, to curdle the blood, and quicken the beatings of the heart."
results.name: LITERATURE AND LIBATIONS - Frankenstein by Mary Shelley

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

results.description:
"What’s wrong with me?"  Insecurity, doubt, self-hatred and other good stuff. Presenter: Paul R. Fulton.  How we answer this question has everything to do with how we respond.  Though our clinical language offers maps and methods for a range of emotional suffering, if we misunderstand the nature of our suffering, we are prone to make things worse through misdirected effort.  In this talk I will examine psychotherapeutic and Buddhist approaches to understanding neurotic misery and ordinary human unhappiness, with particular attention to that particularly persistent form of suffering often known as insecurity. 

At the completion of this activity, participants should be able to:

1. Identify how insecurity informs our work as clinicians

2. Understand the implications of taking a clinical perspective on insecurity

3. Understand a Buddhist perspective on insecurity

Paul Fulton is a clinical psychologist, founding member of IMP and director of the certificate program in Mindfulness based psychotherapy. Dr. Fulton has been teaching about psychology and meditation for many years and is a co-editor of the book, Mindfulness and Psychotherapy, Second Edition.

This monthly continuing education (CE) program presented by the Institute For Meditation & Psychotherapy is for psychotherapists interested in Buddhist psychology, meditation, or mindfulness. Each lecture will address theoretical and clinical issues at the interface of these rich healing traditions, with topics ranging from addictions to forgiveness to countertransference. These community evenings offer an opportunity to gather with colleagues in an informal setting to explore the intersection between Buddhist psychology and modern psychotherapy. This year’s presenters are long- term meditators with significant expertise in practice and in teaching. Each presentation will be followed by Q&A and discussion, moderated by Christopher Willard, PsyD. 2 CE’s are offered each evening to psychologists, social workers, nurses, LMFTs and LMHCs. $25/members of IMP, $30/non-members, $10/mental health students with ID. 9-month series $175/members, $225/non-members ~ no refunds > missed sessions

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Richard D. Vetstein, Esq., is a nationally recognized real estate attorney and litigator. He has contributed to articles in the Boston Globe, Banker & Tradesman, Wall Street Journal’s SmartMoney.com, Bloomberg News, and Massachusetts Lawyers Weekly.

Having handled over 5000 evictions for landlords, Rich recently testified at the Mass. State House in support of the Rent Escrow Bill and lobbied for the Act Clearing Title to Foreclosed Properties. Rich is also the immediate past Co-Chair of the Boston Bar Association’s Title & Conveyancing Committee.

Mr. Vetstein is also the creator and principal author of the highest trafficked real estate legal blog in the U.S., The Massachusetts Real Estate Law Blog. The Blog has won the coveted American Bar Association Top Legal Blawg honor and was recognized in Boston Magazine’s Top 5 Real Estate Blogs.

Mr. Vetstein will be speaking about security deposit law and rental discrimination.

Come join us! 

Education, Have’s and Wants, Structured Networking activities and the Boston Market Update Discussion all combine to make the Association an integral part of any active investor’s month. 

5:30 PM –  "Meeting Before The Meeting" – Multifamily Investing with Charles Dobens

6:30 PM – Registration & Vendor Area Open

7:00 – 7:30 pm – Announcements, Deal Making, Speed Networking

7:30 – 8:00 pm -  What You Need To Know BEFORE Placing An Offer

Lee Abdella of Walsh Home Inspections will address what you should look for before putting an offer in on a house or before waiting your home inspection!

8:00 – 9:00 pm  – Mass Security Deposit and Rental Law  with Richard Vetstein Esq.

Richard D. Vetstein, Esq., is a nationally recognized real estate attorney and litigator. He has contributed to articles in the Boston Globe, Banker & Tradesman, Wall Street Journal’s SmartMoney.com, Bloomberg News, and Massachusetts Lawyers Weekly.

Having handled over 5000 evictions for landlords, Rich recently testified at the Mass. State House in support of the Rent Escrow Bill and lobbied for the Act Clearing Title to Foreclosed Properties. Rich is also the immediate past Co-Chair of the Boston Bar Association’s Title & Conveyancing Committee.

Mr. Vetstein is also the creator and principal author of the highest trafficked real estate legal blog in the U.S., The Massachusetts Real Estate Law Blog. The Blog has won the coveted American Bar Association Top Legal Blawg honor and was recognized in Boston Magazine’s Top 5 Real Estate Blogs.

Mr. Vetstein will be speaking about security deposit law and rental discrimination.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 

The Boston Real Estate Investors Association  is open to real estate investors of all experience levels who want to meet and continuously learn from other investors and real estate professionals. 

Each meeting features knowledgeable speakers to guide members through new and relevant topics relating to the many aspects of Real Estate Investment.


It's an opportunity to network with others who share similar goals & needs, to learn about unique & hot properties, to find ways of obtaining & utilizing different sources of capital, and so much more!
results.name: What You Need To Know About Home Inspections, Security Deposits and Rental Law

Demo Night is a chance to see what the top startups are working on, these are the people that are changing the future of business & tech!

Join #TechHubTuesday at a special #SheDemos to experience great demos from exciting female Tech Entrepreneurs hosted in partnership with SheStarts. Follow the #TechhubTuesday all day to see other demos taking place in Bengaluru and then London.

MA 02108

This month female entrepreneurs and/or startups with a woman on their founding team will be given time to demo their product in front of a live audience, it's not a pitch but an opportunity for each startup to explain (and show) what they have been working on. After each demo there is live Q&A with the audience. The idea is to foster innovation and iteration. It's not about slamming the presenter!

Afterwards, stick around for beer and wine, network, and take a look around C-space.

Agenda

6:00 - Doors open. Meet people and get your first drinks.

7:00 - 8:00 Presenters Demo

8:00.... Networking

Presenters


5 Demo Teams

Spoiler Alert: @MySpoilerAlert B2B foodtech solution for wasted food. Online marketplace & reporting platform for food sales, donations, & waste recovery opportunities

meta: @meta allows you to access any file instantly, wherever it is. You’ll go from thinking of a file to editing it in seconds, every time.

Cake: @joincakeapp For-profit social enterprise that offers consumer software products and consultative services. We have a particularly strong impact and focus in healthcare.

Milk On Tap: @milkontap is online marketplace connecting lactation consultants with breastfeeding mothers through secure HD video, chat, and email

Kind Eye / Vendia: @kindeyeweb connecting eco-friendly brands with retailers & consumers

Green Piñata Toys: @greenpinatatoys a toy rental subscription service that offers toxin-free, fun and educational toys for children under 5 years.

Increment: @incrementtweets develops playthings that encourage interaction and exploration among all kids, regardless of ability, age, or gender.

Fit University: @gotfitu is a college student's go-to source for all things health & fitness. We are a community of fit & healthy students.

tradr: @gettradr data-driven mobile ecommerce platform that allows users to easily discover, exchange, buy & sell vintage & handmade goods in a way that is engaging, local & social

Date My Wardrobe: @datemywardrobe online marketplace for renting high-end, luxury fashion from other users (including fashion designers).

Lusterity: @lusterityparty is a special events company built around socially conscious values, designing gorgeous gatherings and doing social good.

results.description:
Decision-making under uncertainty is the problem of acting in complex environments in ways that maximize cumulative reward. Alborz Geramifard, Research Scientist at Amazon, will be leading an introductory workshop on Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) which serve as a natural framework for formulating such problems.

Reinforcement learning and dynamic programming are common solutions to MDPs and have been demonstrated to play backgammon, fly helicopters in acrobatic maneuvers, and automatically read and follow instructions in Microsoft tech support articles. This tutorial will cover the basics of MDPs and discusses how reinforcement learning, and dynamic programing methods can be used to solve MDPs. All algorithms covered are available through the open-source RLPy package.
results.name: Introduction to Markov Decision Processes

Need a breather from code and gear?  Let’s talk art!  Two great local artists will share their process and approaches at BUG on November 3rd, at Akamai in Kendall Square!  Iain Barrett-Bynres will share his Physically Based Rendering pipeline for building next-gen 3D art, and Luigi Guatieri, a 2D artist with many local indie hits under his belt, will talk color theory and visual magic.  


***********************************


How to 3D Without Wanting to Smash Your Computer With a Big Rock

Iain Barrett-Bynres - @BbyrnesArt

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/VNTIegkWE1JSU9m3swT2SvnuUu4B_dd1cLqXqx_iDZumr0yCvWl5zs5SC72CAyRuFuB3A9zg_WMNldOa1PUHpRSFISC6Q3qOm1CbMp-692fst0H5bXUXcl8cnS0TKi2TDuZWjyXF

This talk will be focused on refining a 3D pipeline for Unity using tools that speed up production with a focus on PBR and Unity 5.

Bio:

Iain is the lead 3D Artist at Happy Giant Studios. He works making mobile games for iOS and Android for a range of companies and clients using Unity.


***********************************


Fun with Color Theory!

Luigi Guatieri - @LuigiGland

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/C4NaPTj_n_udPWbBMln7Z0xnWcdO_vxWbntKSSGPhmYTPuy94XIOJIWw2MWh-NyDhm4o-89OPh35gz-p9snAg1OS0npXBP2XLirUk6syQO3YensvG-7-vh8fc3rdQAhsRvUC8O4-

An adventure through all you need to know about color theory to turn your games into visual candy. Learn magic words to communicate better with artists and make them respect you. Some unity tips that I use to make things POP. Come and help me validate my art degree.

Bio:

Luigi is a local Boston game artist who has worked on a number of awesome independent games including Girls Like Robots, Elegy for a Dead World, The Counting Kingdom and more!

In his spare time he fights robots.

***********************************


Please RSVP so we can ensure enough food and drinks for the attendees! 

Our Sponsors:

Thanks to our sponsors! Unity and Akamai are generously sponsoring our meetup again this month. 


See you there! 
- B.U.G.
results.name: Practical Art Theory & PBR Pipelines: Make your Unity Project Shine

results.description:
Welcome to the first ever Docker Hack Night in Boston!

A Hack Night is not like a regular meetup with sessions, instead it is focused on getting you more time to be hands-on with Docker and related tech.

So what do you do at a Hack Night?

It's meant for you to find time to work on projects, learn more about how to use Docker, find people to work with, network and have fun!

Are you completely new to Docker? Then this is for you.

Are you a veteran and would love to help others get up to speed? Then we want you there :)

Do you have a project that you would like to share with others? Come on over!

So bring your laptops, and projects if you have any, and join us at VMTurbo's offices in Boston.

We'll run from 6PM to 9PM with an intro session at 6:30-7:30 with a focus on getting comfortable with the Docker Toolbox.

Help wanted!

Would you like to help us hosting these Hack Nights, do intro sessions, coordinate interesting labs, help people get started or perhaps something else? Please send a message to Jonas Rosland and explain what you'd like to do to help out.
results.name: Docker Hack Night

results.description:
Come out and meet and mingle with other Boston Science Fiction and Fantasy fans at our monthly Social Meetup! We meet for food, drinks, games, and excellent companionship. We'll be at M.J. O'Connor's (the Park Plaza location). They are reserving their entire 150 person back room exclusively for us! I'll bring some board games along. 


More about M.J. O'Connor's here: http://back-bay.mjoconnors.com/

Please keep in mind that there are a couple of M.J. O'Connor locations, we'll be at the Park Plaza location at 27 Columbus Ave. in Boston

LOGISTICS:

* There is no theme or agenda, just people talking about Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and geeky things that we like (and dislike). If you can't come on time, that's fine, we usually have a large group until 8:00 PM. M.J. O'Connors is open until 2am if you want to stay extra late, but they will open up the room to the public at 9:00pm.

* If you have SciFi/Fantasy Books or DVDs that you don't want anymore, feel free to bring them to the meetup and give them away (no sales, please). Be sure to take home anything that isn't claimed before you leave!

* There is no charge for this meetup, but the restaurant that hosts us greatly appreciates your business (and doesn't charge us a room rental fee), so please come hungry (or at least buy a drink). Also, please don't forget to pay your bill before you leave!


TRAVEL:

It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the Park Street T stop (Red and green) and a five minute walk from either Arlington and the Boylston stops on the green line

There are pay parking lots around. For example, the Motor Mart Garage (motormartgarage.com) which is just around the block and is $10 for up to 3 hours, if you come in after 5pm.

Here is a map to the location.

There are some metered parking spots for the those willing to drive around and be patient, but only a few.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the back room on the Park Plaza side of the restaurant. Ask for the sci-fi meetup and they'll show you the way.
results.name: November Social Meetup 2015 - and game night if only you bring games

results.description:
Please join us for an evening dedicated to the most important issues one faces when going through divorce or separation, as well as afterwards. Michael (Mick) Judge, seasoned divorce attorney from Burns & Levinson, LLP will talk you through the process and what you can expect financially, as well as cover common mistakes that people make and how to avoid them.

Divorce can be a traumatic and complex process. This seminar is designed to provide a simple explanation of the divorce process and is intended to demystify some of the key issues involved in a divorce. From the filing of a complaint for divorce to the trial of a contested divorce case, Attorney Judge will walk you through the steps of a divorce case, including, but not limited to:

How is a divorce case started?
What types of divorces are there?
How are child custody cases handled?
What is the role of a guardian ad litem?
How is child support calculated?
What constitutes Marital Property and how is it divided?
How are debts divided?
Am I entitled to, or will I have to pay, spousal support?
Who pays for health and life insurance?
How do we file our taxes?
Can I make my spouse pay for my lawyer?
When and how does a divorce become final?

Attorney Judge will also briefly discuss a broad spectrum of pre-divorce considerations (including pre-nuptial agreements, divorce mediation and marriage counseling), as well as post-divorce matters (including modifications and contempt actions).

There is no charge for attendance and complimentary refreshments and light fare will be provided for your enjoyment throughout the event.

Please click this link for more information on Attorney Judge:
http://www.burnslev.com/our-attorneys/michael-judge

Directions: If you are taking public transportation, 125 Summer Street is located just a few blocks away from both South Station and Downtown Crossing. If you are driving, you can park in the parking garage of 125 Summer Street. Bring your parking ticket with you to Burns & Levinson (where you check into the seminar on the 8th floor) and you can pay $10 (cash or check) to receive a voucher for parking.
results.how_to_find_us: Garage parking is available at 125 Summer Street for a discounted rate of $10. Burns & Levinson is located on the 8th floor. Please call/text Deanna at 508-333-3191 with questions or for directions.
results.name: The ABC's of Divorce: Now is the time to begin your education...

results.description:
Have you read or heard of the book “Getting to Yes” published by Harvard Negotiation Project? Arguably as the “negotiation bible” at most business school curriculums, it has stayed as #1 ranking in the “Job Hunting & Careers – Guide” category and #1 in the “Management & Leadership – Negotiation” category at Amazon for a long time! Now you will have an opportunity to talk to someone who’s the mastermind behind the work!

It is Women in NAAAP (WIN)'s honor and pleasure to host a workshop presented by Paul Cramer, a well-known negotiation specialist, Managing Director and Co-Leader at Accenture Negotiation Center of Excellence. Paul is a leading negotiation specialist known for his work developing "interest based" negotiation strategy. He worked extensively with the late Roger Fisher, founder of the Harvard Negotiation Project and author of Getting to YES. Come join WIN on November 3rd 6 PM – 8PM at the Accenture office for a discussion with Paul for an engaging discussion about the art of successful negotiation in/outside of the workplace and how you can use it to advance your professional/personal lives. Refreshments and beverage will be served at the workshop and networking reception to follow afterwards.

Please RSVP via clicking the link. Space is limited to 25 attendees! First 15 RSVPs will receive a free copy of the book, Getting to Yes. http://www.naaapboston.org/events/save-the-date-the-art-of-win-negotiation/

Please contact WIN at [masked] with any questions about this event and send us questions you’d like Paul to address during the workshop. We hope to see you there. Thanks!
results.name: The Art of WIN a Negotiation

results.description:
From contact forms to SEO to social media, plugins can add whatever functionality you want into your WordPress site. In this workshop, over the course of 3 nights, you'll learn how to build a WordPress plugin.

Schedule

The first class (11/03) will be more talking than programming. We'll go over what everyone wants to do, then review the different ways you can work with WordPress as a developer. We'll also talk about how to recover when you break your site.

In the second class (11/10), we'll start working on our example plugin, starting from how to plan out your code. In working on the plugin, you'll see how to add fields to the post screen, how to display custom data on the front end of your site, and how to make sure all of this is secure :)

Depending on the interests of the class, the third meeting (11/17) can be a continuation of the second to practice what was learned, we could dive deeper into any area we may have skimmed over, or we could look at other ways to work with WordPress's code.

Prerequisites

• Some PHP/programming knowledge. If you've written a function & know what an array is, you're good. (Brush up with some codeacademy!)

• A working development environment - this means WordPress is set up somewhere you can easily edit files, usually on your computer itself. This doc is WordPress Theme specific, but there are good resources at the bottom.

• A text editor you're comfortable with, like Sublime Text (cross-platform).

• Do NOT expect that you can use a live site for this workshop, unless you're OK with breaking it.

• There will NOT be computers available, you will need to bring your own.

You'll walk out of this workshop with a plugin you wrote, along with a lot of resources for continuing to learn WordPress development.

Your Teacher

Kelly Dwan is a developer in Cambridge, MA. She works on the VaultPress team at Automattic. In her spare time, Kelly develops themes and contributes to the WordPress project.

Logistics

This class meets 3 times on Tuesdays, starting 11/3, at Microsoft NERD (same location as the monthly meetup).

November 3rd - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

November 10th - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

November 17th - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

The cost of the workshop is $60, and covers all three meetings.
results.name: Build a WordPress Plugin Workshop

results.description:
We start off chatting about our work, including setting goals for ourselves (which is entirely optional but super helpful!), and then we write. That's what it's all about. As simple as the idea is, it's amazing how much more you can get done simply by being in the presence of other writers at work. The baked goods don't hurt, either.


There is power for laptops, and some of us use pen and paper. Your choice! Bonus: there's no Internet access, so you can omit a huge distraction without even trying. And, although we are not a discussion group, there are many areas where people can go if they want to talk without being disruptive.

Please click here for detailed directions! The school can be a bit of a maze and I don't want anybody getting lost.
results.name: Quite Write: Writing Night!

results.description:
Since Americanah is 588 pages, we've decided to skip October to give people extra time to finish the book. Happy reading!


Summary: As teenagers in a Lagos secondary school, Ifemelu and Obinze fall in love. Their Nigeria is under military dictatorship, and people are leaving the country if they can. Ifemelu—beautiful, self-assured—departs for America to study. She suffers defeats and triumphs, finds and loses relationships and friendships, all the while feeling the weight of something she never thought of back home: race. Obinze—the quiet, thoughtful son of a professor—had hoped to join her, but post-9/11 America will not let him in, and he plunges into a dangerous, undocumented life in London. Years later, Obinze is a wealthy man in a newly democratic Nigeria, while Ifemelu has achieved success as a writer of an eye-opening blog about race in America. But when Ifemelu returns to Nigeria, and she and Obinze reignite their shared passion—for their homeland and for each other—they will face the toughest decisions of their lives. -via goodreads.com.


Please support our host restaurant! Bar Lola has delicious drinks and tapas. Order at the bar and then join us in the back room.

results.description:
Gentlepeople,

We are delighted to present a thought-provoking talk by MIT research scientist Peter Gloor at our November meeting, this coming Tuesday night November 3rd.

Coolhunting and Coolfarming through Swarmcreativity

Every disruptive innovation is not the result of a lone inventor, but of a small group of likeminded individuals, working together in close collaboration to get their cool idea off the ground. They are leveraging the concept of swarm creativity, where this small team - the Collaborative Innovation Network (COIN) - empowered by the collaborative technologies of the Internet and social media, turns their creative labor of love into a product that changes the way how we think, work, or spend our
day.

The presentation introduces the concept of coolhunting, finding new trends by finding the trendsetters, and coolfarming, helping the trendsetters getting their idea over the tipping point. It describes dozens of case studies done with companies around the world, analyzing the new idea creation process through tracking human
interaction patterns on three levels.

This Tuesday November 3rd, your Boston Network Users Group, BNUG, will meet at Mass Bay Community College in Wellesley Hills. As usual, admission is FREE and open to all. Munchies and Intermingling (M&I) starts at 6:30pm, the meeting will start by 7pm and must end by 8:30pm.

About the speaker: Peter A. Gloor is a Research Scientist at the Center for Collective Intelligence at MIT's Sloan School of Management where he leads a project exploring Collaborative Innovation Networks (COIN). He is also Founder and Chief Creative Officer of software company galaxyadvisors where he puts his academic insights to practical use, helping clients to coolhunt by analyzing social networking patterns on the Internet – spot the next big thing by finding the trendsetters, and to coolfarm – make the cool trends succeed on online social networking sites. He blogs about Swarm Creativity at swarmcreativity.blogspot.com. Contact him at [masked] .

IMPORTANT: You need to have a (free) parking permit and directions. These are located online (print yours) at http://www.bnug.org/parkingpermit -- you can park right next to the building (flagpole area) if you want and display this permit.

Please let me know if you plan to come or even if you may come so we can have enough space and munchies. Thanks.

Regards,
-steve
Steve Isenberg
President, BNUG
results.name: Learn about Coolhunting and Coolfarming through Swarmcreativity

results.description:
The Mystery Speaker Series continues with Mystery Speaker #3! 

Every Tuesday, Branchfood will host an entrepreneur to tell the story of how they launched a successful food enterprise (#BOSFoodStories). This recurring series debuted Oct 20th with Mark Andrus from Stacy’s Pita Chips. The first #BOSFoodStories event was an enormous success drawing 30+ food entrepreneurs and foodies. Mark delivered his #foodstory on how he hustled his pita chip from a food cart in downtown Boston to Trader Joe's to Costco and finally selling to PepsiCo just ten years after conception. 

This series continues TOMORROW Oct 27th with this mystery speaker (can you guess this chocothlete?).

Our THIRD mystery speaker represents Boston’s female founder startup contingent. Join us to learn about early challenges of launching a food biz, what it’s like to be a female entrepreneur in a male dominated field, how to find capital and investors, and how to get your product into major vendors in the Boston Area.

Mystery Speaker #3 will present on November 3rd. This is an intimate event limited to 30 attendees. Tickets are available for $10 on Eventbrite. Please RSVP early to ensure your spot. A special thank you to Sam Adams for sponsoring this series!

Mystery Speaker #3
November 3rd, 6:30 PM
CIC, 50 Milk Street, Boston

This may be the trickiest Mystery Speaker yet. Are you up to the challenge? Here are a few clues.

• Together with her co-founder, this native Bostonian launched this all-natural additive-free beverage in 2014.

• After successfully obtaining seed money from angel investors, the company became one of the 2014 MassChallenge finalists.

• The main ingredient is handpicked from the Greek mountain tops and is known for it's medicinal uses and high antioxidants.

• Now you can purchase the beverage in dozens of grocery chains and specialty shops in the Boston Metro area with eminent expansion into stores throughout New England.

Join us to hear this kick-ass female entrepreneur's story on 11/3. Mystery speakers will be revealed the day of the event.

Who's in?

Lauren, Sarah, and Ally @ Branchfood

results.description:
OPEN CARDS AND BOARD GAME NIGHT

ANTHING GOES TONIGHT - bring your board games, and your card games like Sorry, Yahtzee, Clue, Domino, Scrabble, Apple to Apples, Monopoly, Wizard, etc...

                        Tonight we'll play them all!

   Bring your decks of cards and let the games begin!

Come join the C&C crew over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford for a open cards and board game night.  There is always conversation and dinner first but then we can split up and play whatever there is.

Whether you prefer board games, card games or party games (or just want to meet people!), Tuesday nights will be your opportunity! We welcome  new additions to the group, and it's great to see new friendships being made over board games...

Although we start around 6:30pm or so, early birds (Before 6pm) can take advantage of their half-price happy hour menu. These are full-portion sized appetizers for real cheap! If not, you'll still be able to take advantage of the monthly specials.

HOW TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

results.description:
Reporting requests that are required ‘yesterday or sooner’, oft times necessitate working more efficiently and effectively. We have all been through this at one time or another. In this hands on presentation we shall be looking some of the more challenging techniques of extracting our data from our Multidimensional and Tabular Models, in addition to our Data Mining Models. We shall be utilizing concepts of ‘Openquery()’ and ‘linked servers’ as a means to extract data, in addition to looking at the way that these two concepts can help us extract our data utilizing MDX, DMX and DAX expressions; AND YET maintain the flexibility and the ability to utilize all those wonderful techniques that may be done with T-SQL.

Presenter: Steve Simon 

</a> Steve Simon is a senior BI Development Engineer with Atrion Networking. He has been involved with database design and analysis for over 25 years. Steve has presented papers at eight PASS Summits and one at PASS Europe 2009 and 2010. He has just recently presented a Data Quality Services presentation at the PASS Nordic Rally in Copenhagen. Steve has also presented 5 papers at the Information Builders' (IBI) International Summits. He is a PASS regional mentor & chair of the Oracle/SQL Server VC

Pizza and Soda (Free) provided by Pragmatic Works

Parking: There is free <a>MIT parking lot on Hayward Street.  There is also a free lot across from the Alewife T stop at the <a>Summer Shack</a>. 


Note: 6:20 PM to 7:00 PM Pizza and Networking time.

We have merged with the Boston Real Estate Investors Association!

The Boston Real Estate Investors Association  is open to real estate investors of all experience levels who want to meet and continuously learn from other investors and real estate professionals. Each meeting features knowledgeable speakers to guide members through new and relevant topics relating to the many aspects of Real Estate Investment. Past events have covered Why invest in Real Estate?, Foreclosures, Self-directed IRA's, 1031 Exchanges, and Creative Tax Strategies.

It's an opportunity to network with others who share similar goals & needs, to learn about unique & hot properties, to find ways of obtaining & utilizing different sources of capital, and so much more!

Find more about us at www.BostonRealEstateInvestorsAsssociation.com

Come join us!

Education, Have’s and Wants, Structured Networking activities and the Boston Market Update Discussion all combine to make the Association an integral part of any active investor’s month.

5:30 PM –  "Meeting Before The Meeting" – Multifamily Investing with Charles Dobens

6:30 PM – Registration & Vendor Area Open

7:00 – 7:30 pm – Announcements, Deal Making, Speed Networking

7:30 – 8:00 pm -  What You Need To Know BEFORE Placing An Offer

Lee Abdella of Walsh Home Inspections will address what you should look for before putting an offer in on a house or before waiting your home inspection!

8:00 – 9:00 pm  – Mass Security Deposit and Rental Law  with Richard Vetstein Esq.

Richard D. Vetstein, Esq., is a nationally recognized real estate attorney and litigator. He has contributed to articles in the Boston Globe, Banker & Tradesman, Wall Street Journal’s SmartMoney.com, Bloomberg News, and Massachusetts Lawyers Weekly.

Having handled over 5000 evictions for landlords, Rich recently testified at the Mass. State House in support of the Rent Escrow Bill and lobbied for the Act Clearing Title to Foreclosed Properties. Rich is also the immediate past Co-Chair of the Boston Bar Association’s Title & Conveyancing Committee.

Mr. Vetstein is also the creator and principal author of the highest trafficked real estate legal blog in the U.S., The Massachusetts Real Estate Law Blog. The Blog has won the coveted American Bar Association Top Legal Blawg honor and was recognized in Boston Magazine’s Top 5 Real Estate Blogs.

Mr. Vetstein will be speaking about security deposit law and rental discrimination.

Are you conscious of all the beauty in your heart? Which parts feel closed off; which parts are open?  What would happen if you could expand that beauty, and project it into your world?

Feel power and connection as you tap into the intelligence of your heart.  Feel the connection with others as they share the beauty in their hearts with you. 

Inspired by the HeartMath® Institute, Anne-Marie has used its surprising scientific findings successfully with individuals to help them improve their relationship with themselves and with others.  She has now innovatively applied its findings to small groups. 

She will lead our small group, using guided imagery and art therapy (i.e., symbolic drawing), to help us to access and to radiate the loving power of our hearts.   

We will learn how our heart produces a measurable, powerful electromagnetic field that others experience unconsciously.  We will culminate the night enjoying the healing that is possible when our collective group consciously utilizes our heart fields to connect and to empower.   

You will leave realizing how much more power you have, literally in your heart, to create a loving world. These exercises will all be done in the safe, fun and relaxing atmosphere of our Heartbeat Salon group!

Pleas join us:

- Find what is hidden in your heart
- Experience the joy of opening your heart

- Commit to using the power of your heart to create a happier world.

results.description:
Contact me [Jose (click the link, then click "Message")] for the address.

General board gaming. We have a good library of widely played board games, and people normally bring many more of them. We regularly run three to five tables of board games - this provides enough variety.  It is normal for people to get two or three games a session.  The game night format was inspired by Unity Games and the event is very casual and structureless.  If you have gone to one of the meetup's quarterly events you will know.

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played?
A.  Any type of board game.  Browse through the most popular games at http://boardgamegeek.com/ and that should give you an idea.

Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm?
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  Should I bring something?  
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served. Feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/sodas in the pizza cup. 

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it?
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q.  Where do I park?
A.  The driveway is the obvious spot, but eventually it will fill up on most of these game nights.  Some people do park on the street.  The soccer field parking across the street is a safe option and is the suggestion the town police gave me when I asked about overflow parking.
results.how_to_find_us: The house is just across from a soccer field.  If the driveway starts to fill up, the soccer field parking lot is a good option.

results.description:
Do you find it easy/natural to express your sexual side, or is it a challenge? What does your sexual expression look like? If there was no possibility of judgment, what might your most authentic sexual expression look like? How do you feel when you express your sexual side?

We'll explore these questions and more at the November meeting of Sex Positive Boston, a monthly discussion group organized by Pleasure PIe (pleasurepie.org).

Fun fact: Sex Positive Boston turns one this month! Yay! :)

Following the discussion, we'll have a show and tell of any sexual acceptance related projects anyone is working on. Feel free to bring your project (or information on your project) for show-and-tell, if you have one.

All are welcome. This is for people of all genders, races, ages, etc. Feel free to invite people!

When attending or registering please let Nicole know you heard about the event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup. Thanks!


This is a free event. You are welcome to donate, but it is totally cool not to donate. Donations go to The Democracy Center for hosting us, and to Pleasure Pie for organizing the event.

Join the Sex Positive Boston Facebook group here:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/sexpositiveboston/

Sex Positive Boston strives to be a safer space. We will share what that means to each of us and come up with some guidelines during this meeting, but for now you can check out some guidelines we've used in the past here: http://www.pleasurepie.org/safer-space-guidelines.html

This will be in the Library room in The Democracy Center. It is private and cozy. Unfortunately, the building isn't wheelchair accessible. Please let me know if stairs are a hindrance to you.
results.name: Your Sexual Expression: Sex Positive Boston November Discussion

results.description:
***** Note: there is no Meetup on 11/10 here.  The community center is closed ***

This Meetup is intended for intermediate level players or higher, which means:Yankee C and above level, players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to play 5-1 and 6-2 formations, have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike.



If you'd like to play, please do the following:


1. Send an email to Kory using the following URL: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=8675200

2. In the message please indicate the date of event and your preferred position so we can make sure we have the right mix. ( If I don't know your position already)

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters,  and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well.

The location for this volleyball meetup is at the Orient Heights Community Center located at 86 Boardman Street in East Boston. Kory and Wing will be hosting these Tuesday night volleyball meetups.

This event is free if you are a member of Boston Community Centers. If not, it's a one-time $20 membership fee that is valid for a year. The Community Center is a short walk away from the Orient Heights T Stop on the Blue Line and also has plenty of parking. When you drive up, turn at the Mariott Hotel Sign and park in the lot or further along the fence.

As always, please remember:

- Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP)

- The gym is open before the event to warm up, so please arrive a little early if you would like to warm up and stretch as we would like to start the game promptly from 7:00PM

- If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join.  Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.
results.name: 11/03  Intermediate+ Indoor Volleyball East Boston

results.description:
Medical practitioners have long identified stress as a root cause of many of our modern ailments, from high blood pressure and gastrointestinal problems to anxiety and depression.

This simple and powerful process can be learned in one session and requires an investment of 12-15 minutes a day. It has the potential to transform the life of anyone who is willing to incorporate it into their everyday life.

Created by yogi and humanitarian Sadhguru Vasudev, Isha Kriya is rooted in the timeless wisdom of the yogic sciences. Today, for most people, the work "yoga usually conjures up images of twisting the body and impossible postures. The physical aspect of Yoga is only one facet of this multi-dimensional science. Yoga is a technology to bring the body and mind to the peak of their capabilities, allowing one to live to the fullest. Daily practice of Isha Kriya offers:

              * Enhanced clarity

              * Improved health

              * Heightened focus and energy

              * Greater prosperity and a state of peacefulness and joy

results.description:
Please join Lama Rod Owens as he continues his series on Practice During Periods of Turbulence and Apparent Social Injustice. Lama Rod Owens is a graduate of the traditional 3 Year Retreat program at Kagyu Thubten Choling Monastery where he received his teaching authorization from his root teacher, The Venerable Lama Norlha Rinpoche. He is currently a resident teacher with Natural Dharma Fellowship in Cambridge, MA and is pursuing his graduate studies in Buddhism at Harvard Divinity School.  He has served as the Lama and Program Director of Kagyu DC, a Tibetan Buddhist Dharma Center and community in Washington, D.C. Lama Rod specializes in applying the teachings of Mahamudra meditation in exploring racial and gender constructs, healing woundedness from trauma and other violence, as well as integrating spirituality and sexuality. Lama Rod is also a practicing reiki master.


On the evenings when Lama Rod teaches, he will be available at 6:00 PM for Personal Practice Dialogues: A small group discussion open to any practitioner with the goal of dialoguing about issues in personal practice that may not be able to be explored in the regular gathering at 7:00. If you would like to see him at 6:00, send him an email: [masked].

Natural Dharma Fellowship practices in the Tibetan Buddhist traditions of Dzogchen and Mahamudra. More details and information about our group can be found at the following URL:

http://www.naturaldharma.org

Please note: most of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending than are signed up using this web site.
results.name: Dharma Teaching with Lama Rod Owens
