results.description:
Get your tickets IMMEDIATELY, RIGHT NOW, ASAP if you want to attend Our Family Dinner.

Boston has eagerly awaited our turn at the table of this wonderful community building gathering. Don't delay or you will be saying woulda coulda shoulda.

Our Family Dinner is a community-based tradition that hosts young adults over family inspired city-wide and neighborhood-based dinners to build community in major cities around the world. Join the Family!


RESTRICTIONS: Refunds will not be issued outside of 48 hours from day of purchase or forward purchases to future dates; however, confirmations are transferable and you are free to extend your place at purchase value to the family.
results.name: Our Family Dinner Boston - "If It Isn't Love"

results.description:
You asked for it, you got it! Check out a new hot night, TWISTED T-Dance!

T-Dances have always been a huge part of our culture, bringing the entire LGBTQ community together all under one roof. This time around, we are just adding a little twist to the mix. Twisted T-Dance offers you not one, but two DJ's spinning different genres all night long. That's SIX hours of non-stop dancing!!

If you have not been upstairs at Murphy's, you are missing out! This dance room is a hidden jewel with their state of the art lighting and sound system!

This is a 21+ with $8 cover event.
Want to get in FREE? Join our event on FB to be automatically entered, winners chosen day of event.

** No wheelchair access to get upstairs **

Stay tuned for some great drink specials, monthly sponsors, and twisted announcements.

Share with your friends, spread the word, and let's take the Northshore by storm!!

Added Bonus:
After 10 pm - Murphy's resident DJ will take over the decks, so KEEP your wristbands on and dance until closing, an pay no extra cover charge!
results.name: Twisted T-Dance

results.description:
This Meetup is for folks who want to learn more about Cityscapes with bridges, high-rises, streaking cars and reflections. Please note we will meet at the following co-ordinates as mentioned at the exact time. Note Daylight Saving will be off for this date so we will meet sharp at 4:30 PM EST.


Where do I park?? There are ample parking spots absolutely free of cost! This is a recreational area and lots people will be there at the park, if the weather is not too cold. The restriction for parking is till 10:00 pm. After which certain gates are closed. This is a small area so we should be done well before the closing time.


What kind of equipment should I bring?? Medium Wide to Zoom are the best lens for shooting in this park. A 24-70 mm is a good range. Long range zooms are pretty handy since the city features are a tad bit far off. To get more reach you might want to go for the 100 mm or 135 mm or even higher. UWA in this area might not be the lens that you want, but then again suit your taste if you want to take something different. A lens shade is a must for strong lights!


What kind of a place is this?? This is park is a safe place with ample features, easy walking paths, beautiful views of the Tobin Bridge and iconic structures in downtown Boston with an access to the waterfront. There are numerous strong lights and if you are wary about flares please carry lens shades.


What will the weather be like?? The weather during this time of the year is usually upper forties to lower forties. Although this is the hurricane season and if there are severe disruptions the event will be rescheduled. We will be close to the New Moon Phase. So if the skies are clear it calls for an opportunity for Urban star trails. Please dress accordingly and stay warm. It can get colder near the waterfront areas. Get Hand warmers, in case of Lens condensation. Be careful with your equipment especially with your tripods, be mindful of others shooting in the vicinity and enjoy the night.


Pictures from the park are provided below:


Walking Map:
results.name: Mystic River Access and Tobin Memorial Bridge

results.description:
The Level 1 Intimate Puja Circle is for you if:


• You have never participated in an Intimate Puja Circle with me before (and if you have, you are still invited) 

• You would like to come to a Friday Night Intimate Puja Circle (this is now a pre-requisite; some exceptions may apply) 

• You feel nervous when it comes to a deeper level intimacy 

• You want to learn the vital skills of honoring boundaries, finding your yes/no, and conscious communication

• You are interested in a gentle introduction to Tantra and the Intimate Puja Circles 

•  You're ready to be playful and have fun! 

NOTE - You must pay to reserve your spot as these Pujas SELL OUT every month!  

_______________________________


A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.  

https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ui=2&ik=5b093d1404&view=fimg&th=1509ed2c64eb8999&attid=0.1&disp=emb&realattid=ii_ig6fpqfr0_1509ec41de80be5e&attbid=ANGjdJ_q49fKehHkQhQh6YBBeMtIr9XwdyF5PQkf3dK2ISY0RmSCgpYgdHMPg_9JMalYkOHXvBvYZkyXfQ_YwRdSdw6Yh38cX2nlQnITn1L1N_QYRSJP3O1pw88wZx0&sz=w960-h774&ats=1445946005846&rm=1509ed2c64eb8999&zw&atsh=1

_________________________________________

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn, of Come Back to Love TM, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience "Tantric Speed Dating" as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying:

"We had such a wonderful time.  Thank you for your open, joyful and steady facilitation of the group.  It was a great experience."

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

_________________________

The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"></a> itself will begin part-way through during which you'll have the chance to connect with others (one-on-one) -- this part  will be facilitated, with a structure provided. You will be encouraged to practice and learn the following: 

Honoring your own boundaries Honoring others' boundariesWhat it means to provide consent Finding your 'yes' and your 'no' and speaking them aloudTouch with permission only The energetics of intimacy that provide balance in connection 

You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.

Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  In fact, this event teaches relationship skills that are vital for a creating a juicy, harmonious, long term connection. Come alone or bring your partner.  

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist.  I don't recommend you wear skirts, dresses, or kilts. 

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS, your partner, your present self!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous: Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked] 

5.  How do I sign up?  Click here to pay:  <a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZYM4UYJ22MHNN">https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZYM4UYJ22MHNN
results.name: SOLD OUT Intimate Puja Circle - An Intro to Intimate Pujas

The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through during which you'll have the chance to connect with others (one-on-one) -- this part  will be facilitated, with a structure provided. You will be encouraged to practice and learn the following: 

Honoring your own boundaries Honoring others' boundariesWhat it means to provide consent Finding your 'yes' and your 'no' and speaking them aloudTouch with permission only The energetics of intimacy that provide balance in connection 

You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.

Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  In fact, this event teaches relationship skills that are vital for a creating a juicy, harmonious, long term connection. Come alone or bring your partner.  

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist.  I don't recommend you wear skirts, dresses, or kilts. 

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS, your partner, your present self!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous: Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked]

results.description:
11/7 - Screening of "Toxic Hot Seat"
6-8:30pm
The John D. O'Bryant African American Institute
Northeastern University

http://www.toxichotseatmovie.com/


TOXIC HOT SEAT is environmental filmmaking at its pinnacle—
revealing, horrifying, infuriating, compelling, and hopeful." 
CineSource Magazine

ABOUT TOXIC HOT SEAT

Chemical flame retardants are everywhere. Our furniture. Our homes.
Our bodies. But do they work as promised? And are they making us sick?

The three chemical companies producing flame retardants would prefer that we not ask these questions, and they've spent millions of dollars on lobbyists, publicists and influencers to ensure that we don't. It might remind you of the Big Tobacco cover-up. Which makes sense, since Big Tobacco has had a hand in this, too.

Set against the backdrop of the award-winning 2012 Chicago Tribune investigative series "Playing With Fire," TOXIC HOT SEAT threads together an intricate story of manipulation that details how Big Tobacco skillfully convinced fire safety officials to back a standard that, in effect, requires all furniture to be filled with toxic flame retardants. The film continues to untangle how the chemical companies obscure the risks to public health and misrepresent chemical safety data by paying "experts" to alarm legislators and the public about the deadly risk of removing chemical flame retardants from our homes.

Through the personal stories of a cancer-surviving firefighter, a renowned chemist whose work helped remove fire retardants from kid's pajamas in the 1970s, and a brave and determined young Maine legislator and mom, TOXIC HOT SEAT reveals the courage of brave citizens willing to fight for the truth against a shadowy nexus of money and politics.

[40 Leon Street is a apartment building located at 40 Leon Street, Boston, MA 02115, in the area is commonly known as Fenway-Kenmore.]

http://yogaacton.com/crystal-bowl-sound-immersion/

Possibilities. You enter this life with so many of them. But then, somewhere along the way, you seem to have fewer and fewer of them. Your life can feel like a well-worn track. Where did all the possibilities go? They still exist, but beliefs, ideas and patterns acquired over a lifetime tend to bury them. Crystal Bowl Healings work to quickly shift your vibrational energy field and release whatever is limiting you; Whether it’s a belief that you have enough and it would be selfish to want more, or that you don’t deserve to have what you want in life.

As you sit or lay in a meditative state, I play the bowls, allowing the beautiful sounds and vibrations to work their magic in your energy field. The bowls play differently each time, affected by the energy in the room and what is needed to help you release old patterns.

By the end of the session, you will be ready for the new possibilities that are about to walk right into your life!

The crystal bowls are for you if you are:

Stuck in any area of your life
Wanting to experience more out of life but aren’t sure how
Experiencing self- sabotaging patterns
Wanting to make a change in life but aren’t sure how
Wanting to make changes at your own pace
Come discover the power of intentionally releasing and being open to what the universe is calling for you to bring into your life!

results.description:
If you wish to join us, get tickets for Section B - we'll all gather there and eat together.  It will be a smaller group.  Please order your tickets now at www.johnnyds.com  .   Tickets will sell out quickly and I can't guarantee you can join us unless you buy the tickets. 

Take one red-hot horn section - we're talkin' alto, tenor, baritone saxes and trombone - down and dirty. Add liberal amounts of barrelhouse boogie-woogie piano and stinging Fender guitar. Pour over a funky and swinging rhythm section that Blues Review magazine called "the best in the business", and top it all off with a crazy and charismatic front man with one of the biggest blues voices around. Season with a few years on the road tearing up juke joints, festivals and concert halls across the U.S. and Canada and on both sides of the Atlantic. Sound tasty? It's a recipe for music and mayhem, for intensity and irreverence; it's THE LOVE DOGS.

Based out of Boston, this hard blowing septet just celebrated its sixteenth year wowing audiences and critics alike with their combination of great musicianship and pure fun. The Dogs combine elements of jump blues, New Orleans R&B and early rock 'n' roll into their own powerhouse sound. You can hear it loud and clear on their three Tone-Cool cds "I'm Yo Dog" (1996), "Heavy Petting" (1998) and "New Tricks" (2000). Many of the cuts from these three discs have been blues radio favorites, several of the Dogs' signature original songs have been used in feature films and on television, and one has even been sampled for use on the upcoming Run-DMC cd!

But as much fun as the Dogs' studio discs are, it's nothing compared to seeing them live. FMQB magazine called Love Dogs' concerts "the stuff of legend" where "soulful vocals, killer grooves, unpredictability and pure entertainment play equal parts". With their newest cd "Live And On Fire" The Love Dogs have finally captured the unbridled energy of their live show on disc. Far from a live retread of previously recorded tunes, "Live And On Fire" features ten brand new tracks captured live on a summer weekend at the famous Sea Note nightclub on the outskirts of Boston.

"It's important to us to have fun, and sometimes even we don't know what we're gonna do next." says lead vocalist and songwriter EDDIE "DUATO" SCHEER, a former sideman of R&B legend Johnny Adams. "We have a lot of humor in our music, and we love to surprise each other and make each other laugh. When a crowd can see that, it becomes contagious. Pretty soon they're giving us back as much energy as we're putting out, and the whole thing keeps escalating. We call it the 'tribal love vibe'".

Featuring some of the Northeast's best players, it's impossible not to notice the high level of musicianship in this band. "We're all lifetime fans of blues, jazz, and R&B, and we all have a real reverence for the music. Part of what makes this band special is that we really play together as a unit, and the whole is greater than the sum of its parts." The band's lineup consists of SCHEER, ALIZON LISSANCE (keyboards, vocals), MYANNA (alto/tenor sax, vocals), GLENN SHAMBROOM (guitar, baritone sax), RANDY BRAMWELL (bass, vocals), STEVE BROWN (drums, vocals), along with part time Dogs MARIO PERRETT (tenor sax/vocals), MARK PAQUIN (tenor sax, trombone) and old friend "SAX" GORDON BEADLE (tenor and baritone sax).

Part Rat Pack party, part 20th century musical encyclopedia, and part revival meeting, "Live And On Fire" showcases the Dogs at their best, leaving their audience breathless and begging for more. The New York Post says "Even though the music could make Leonardo's David dance, it's the songwriting that separates these dogs from the rest of the pack" and Blues Review agrees "If there were a Superbowl for crowd pleasing rhythm & blues, a photo of The Love Dogs would be on every Wheaties box in America." Scheer sums it up by saying "If this band doesn't put a smile on your face, check your pulse because you just might be dead."

results.description:
"Jabberwocky" is a poem by Lewis Carroll, and appears in the story "Through the Looking Glass and What Alice Found There".

Here is a link to the full poem: http://www.potw.org/archive/potw128.html

This is this month's challenge for the Images Group, a small photography group that I belong to.

I'm asking any of you to "use all your powers and all your skills" to help me create a mythical landscape and a "Jabberwock" (sort of a scary dragon),  which my example here is not.  You can also feel free to come work on your own project.

This is not a meetup for beginners.  We won't have time to spend on camera settings.  You'll need to be comfortable operating your camera in the dark. That being said,  you don't have to be a master light painter, come and bring gadgets and creative ideas.  No headlamps and no large utility flashlights from Home Depot please.  Anything else is fine.  

As always, this will be weather dependent.  We don't need clear skies to do it.  Dress warmly, and in layers.  Sturdy waterproof or water resistant hiking shoes are a good idea.  A little climbing over snow fences may be needed.

It will be a dark night, with the moon setting in the afternoon.
results.name: Jabberwocky Project:light painting

results.description:
Awesome!  I love Peanuts!  This will definitely be a evening full of giggles and nostalgia.


Showtime is at 7:30, I will be at the theater by 6:30 and we will head in for seats at 7.  The movie is showing upstairs, so we will gather at the tables near the windows at the top of the stairs.  That is unless they decide to corral us into lines downstairs.   If the do that, just get in line and head directly to the theater.   If you miss the group before the movie, we will meet in the hallway after, so come find us.  Tickets are on sale on Fandango now.   Please be aware that these tickets have been selling very quickly and will likely sell out.


In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

results.description:
Great movie, wonderful people, yummy snacks, awesome tea and interesting conversations! Join us for a special movie night!

This wonderful and unique movieSomething Unknown... has received many awards for revealing profound insights into the world of the unseen.


Something Unknown explores these five scientifically 'accepted' areas of parapsychology:

Telepathy refers to mind-reading or mind-to-mind communication. It literally means "distant feeling".

Clairvoyance the psychic ability to perceive remote places, objects or people. A scientific term for clairvoyance is 'Remote Viewing'.

Precognition an alleged psychic ability to predict the future. It sometimes comes as a vision, a mental flash or a dream.

Psychokinesis, 'PK' for short, is the ability to move objects with the power of the mind only.

Psychic Healing a spiritual practice that may afford gradual relief from pain or sickness, and sometimes brings about sudden 'miracle cures'.

Top scientists, parapsychologists, psychologists, doctors, physicists, healers, and explorers...

To see the trailer visit https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VV9rftID2qQ

Time frame for the event:

6:30pm - gathering, tea, snacks

7pm - movie

8:45pm - discussion (participating and staying is optional) 

9:30pm - the doors closed

What to bring :  Yourself, your friends ( male and female:) and any snacks you would like to have and possibly share with others.

Hot tea will be provided!

Price:  $5.00 

Donations of more are always welcome to support the enthusiastic organizers!

results.description:
We will journey inward in a time-honored shamanic method of inner consultation. It is a way of communicating with your inner or spirit self and retrieving information. Your inner self is in constant communication with all aspects of your environment, seen and unseen. You need only journey within to find answers to your questions. Be prepared, however, for whatever insights you may receive, whether you like them or not.
The spirit healing journey is not always what people expect, and sometimes there is uncertainty as to what one should experience in altered states. The ecstatic trance is an individual journey into non-ordinary reality; therefore, experiences vary from person to person and from journey to journey. Once you enter a trance state, the rhythm or sound of the drum tends to change. The drumbeat may appear to speed up or slow down, while the sound may grow louder, softer, or disappear. You may experience a change in body temperature, feel energy flowing through your body, or find yourself twitching, swaying, or rocking. It is not uncommon to hear sounds or voices. You may even smell specific aromas. You may see colorful patterns, symbolic images, or dreamlike visions. Some people may find that they have a highly developed inner vision while others may rely more on instinct, intuition, or intent.
During the spirit healing journey, one's awareness transcends ordinary reality. In journeys to the Lower World, one may experience the sensation of falling, sliding, or spiraling downward into or under the Earth. In Upper World journeys, one may experience the sensation of rising, floating, flying, or spiraling upward through the air or sky. Journeys to the Lower World involve the movement of awareness to a level beneath ordinary reality and Celestial journeys involve movement to a level above ordinary reality. Lower levels are denser, lower in frequency, and more involved with the physical body, the earthly plane, and material reality. Higher levels are higher in frequency, less dense, and subtler.
You will experience at least two spiritual journeys. You do not need prior journeying experiences but an openness of the process and possibilities. Elaine is a training and practicing Shaman and will safely lead you on your journey. Please bring a yoga mat, blanket, something to cover your eyes (scarf), and journal as you may wish to write your experiences immediately following the journey. $10 Any questions or to register please contact Elaine [masked] or[masked]
results.name: An Evening of Shamanic Spiritual Healing

results.description:
Get ready for another fun night of Dodgeball!

All athletic abilities are welcome.  We will be playing against each other on a padded floor, wearing socks, and using NERF/soft-style balls that are easy to throw and do not hurt when you get pegged (unlike those red rubber balls we used on the school playground!).  The facility is air conditioned and there are bathrooms to change from/to street clothes. The cost is $10.

This is a joint event with a number of the Boston-area single parent Meetup groups.  After Dodgeball, we will head out for drinks/appetizers at a nearby location (TBD).

Dodgeball of Boston is located at Together in Motion, 1 Broadway, in Arlington. It is at the intersection of Route 16 and Broadway on the Arlington/Somerville line.

Important: Please be sure to bring socks with you in order to play!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Looking forward to hosting you all at my apartment in a couple weeks to taste some (hopefully) beautiful and rich Cabernets.

Please bring: 4 tasting glasses, a Cabernet Sauvignon from California, (particular region in California doesn't matter to me), in the brown bag that you get from your wine store and $10 for food (which I'll provide). 

As for price of the wine to bring, I'm thinking somewhere in the $25- $50 range, but if there's a Cabernet you enjoy that is $20 or $60, don't let that stop you from bringing it. Just please don't randomingly pick up the cheapest Cabernet you can find either. :-? I don't expect this to be a tasting of Silver Oak Cabs, but I'm not looking to taste any Cupcake or Barefoot Cabs either. :-? 

Please note I have a 60 lb. rescue dog in case anyone is allergic or afraid of dogs. She'll be in my bedroom for the majority of the tasting, but want everyone to be aware. 

Plenty of street parking (no permit needed in Arlington). Getting here by Public Transport could be tricky- T doesn't make it this far. But there is a bus stop at the end of the street. 

My address and phone # to be sent a couple days prior to the event.

Looking forward to seeing you all in a few weeks!

Cristina
results.name: Blind Tasting- California Cabernets

results.description:
I received a thank-you letter from Bertucci's last week for being a "loyal guest" in which they offered to set up a Happy Hour for me at a day and time of my choosing in the bar and lounge area!  Here it is!

Join us for some of the better brick-oven pizza and calzones in town as well as plenty of delicious entrees.  The Tuscan Chicken Wings, pictured below, are especially good.

The restaurant is also offering a four-bucket deal with four kinds of beer, each worth less than $5.  We're not obligated to stick to these items, of course.  You can order whatever you want and pay for it individually.  I recommend bringing cash.

See you there!

Tickets at www.bbcboston.org 

Who's able to come and who can be host for the evening?!

results.description:
Saturday, November 7, 2015, 8pm
Doors open at 7:30pm
First Parish of Watertown
35 Church Street, Watertown
$20 for members and $24 for non-members in advance, $25 for everyone at the door
All children 17 and under free

For public transportation, check the MBTA web site.
This venue is handicap accessible

Purchase tickets online at BrownPaperTickets.com. Tickets can also be purchased at the door.

These three talented women joined forces in 1987 while working on Priscilla's Darkness Into Light recording. The unique blend of their voices encouraged them toward additional collaboration on festival and cocert hall stages. Enthusiastic responses from audiences around the country culminated in the recording of their first album Voices (1990, Flying Fish Records).

Though the album met with critical acclaim, their busy solo careers made only occasional trio performances possible. In 1996 the trio decided to create a more formal program that would allow them to tour for three weeks out of each year.

Their second release, Voices of Winter, was recorded live during that tour and released the subsequent Fall (Gadfly Records). It instantly became a favorite seasonal recording of public radio stations across the country. Called a "genuine folk super-group" by The Boston Globe, separately and together they have garnered countless accolades and awards from radio, press and concert presenters both within and outside the folk community. Their musical alliance has served to bring their collective vocal talents to an even larger and more diverse audience.
Priscilla, Anne and Cindy bring intricate arrangements to newly found musical treasures with an art-song vocal styling that crosses the boundaries of folk and classical music. Their empathy in performance is near telepathic, and the magic of a Herdman, Hills, Mangsen show engages people of all ages and musical backgrounds.
Priscilla, Anne and Cindy headed into the studio in August of 2000 to record their third collaborative effort. At the Turning of the Year includes old and new songs exploring the cycle of the seasons.

The trio was honored to be included in a tribute album, Seeds: The Songs of Pete Seeger, volume 3 released by Appleseed Recordings in the Fall of 2003. They recorded a version of Pete's song "River of My People" for the 2-CD set, which also includes songs and commentary by Pete himself, and versions of his songs sung by many of his friends, including Pat Humphries, Magpie, John McCutcheon, and Tom Paxton.

Herdman, Hills, Mangsen entrances audiences from fireside to concert hall with an evening of fresh enriching music, perfect for a season that asks us to listen to our ancestors, to our traditions, to our hearts and to each other.
results.name: Herdman, Hills and Mangsen Concert

results.description:
Season opener looks great - a terrific Fall concert.  I saw one person wrote this...

The Back Bay Chorale is about to start its 42nd season on Saturday November 7 in Harvard Square with a selection of songs by Brahms and Schubert. These have been loved by audiences since they were first performed. "It's like a lovely box of Candy. German candy. You know how good that can be. Enjoy a crisp fall evening, Harvard Square and some amazing music."

SATURDAY NOVEMBER[masked], 8PM: THE ROMANTICS


St. Paul’s Church, Cambridge

Brahms Liebeslieder Walzer, Op 52
Brahms Zigeunerlieder, Op 103 (selection)
Brahms Four Songs for Women's Chorus, Two Horns and Harp, Op 17
Schubert Songs for Male Chorus — Nachthelle, Der Gondelfahrer, Sehnsucht

Featuring: 
Scott Allen Jarrett, Music Director
Henry Weinberger and Justin Thomas Blackwell, pianists
Elisabeth Axtell and Nick Rubenstein, horns
Anna Elsworth, harp

BACK BAY CHORALE | http://bbcboston.org | <a>[masked]</a> | [masked] | @backbaysings

Knock Knock. Who’s There? The Mendoza Line. Mendoza Line who? THE MENDOZA LINE WHO WON BOSTON A-LISTS BEST NIGHT OF COMEDY, THAT’S WHO YA SILLY IDIOT!

This and every Saturday night live from the back room of the The Dugout Cafe (722 Comm Ave), John Baglio, Julia Claire, and Zach "Zack" Armentrout bring you a different lineup stacked with the biggest, baddest, and bestiest comedians from Boston and beyond. And guess the funk what? Its only FIVE DOLLARS! With drink specials as far as the eye can see and free popcorn, this intimate atmosphere is the perfect place to take in some meaningful and quality laughs!
Featuring the comedic talents of:
Erik Anker (SXSW, High Plains Comedy Festival, Out of Bounds Comedy Festival)

Blair Socci (MTV's upcoming series Ladylike)

Langston Kerman (The Fancy Show, New Faces Showcase at Just For Laughs)

Casey James Salengo (Brooklyn Comedy Festival, Red Clay Comedy Festival)

Matt Ruby (SXSW, Bridgetown Comedy Festival)

Andrew Mayer (Bridgetown Comedy Festival, Boston Comedy Festival)
AND MORE!
Buy your tix now to guarantee a seat as spaces are limited. We don't want to turn you away again, Beverly Cleary
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-mendoza-line-bostons-best-weekly-comedy-showcase-tickets-15228587114

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
